loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Beatrice owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Beatrice has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, de 46 años de edad, depende de padres agricultores, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como vigilante en una gasolinera y tiene 2 hijos, pero solo uno vive con ella.

Teresa, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que estaba con sus padres, ya que ellos eran agricultores y consideraron que enseñarle a ella un oficio, era mejor que ir a la escuela, es por eso que no sabe leer, ni escribir. 

Ahora Teresa, necesita el dinero del crédito para compra de madera, teja, hierro y pagar la mano de obra que le repare el techo de su vivienda, porque se acerca la época lluviosa y como su casa es de barro, teme que el agua se filtre y le moje todas sus cosas.

Su sueño es tener una tienda, para dejar de trabajar en la agricultura y dedicarse a trabajar en su casa.
texts.en:
46-year old Teresa’s parents are farmers. She didn't go to school. Her husband works as a watchman at a gas station; they have two children but only one still lives at home.

Ever since she lived at home, Teresa has worked in agriculture, a job she learned from her parents. They thought farming was more important than education so for that reason she cannot read or write.

Now Teresa needs a loan to buy wood, tiles, and iron sheets, and to pay for the work to be done. She wishes to repair the roof on her house because the rainy season is coming. As her home is made of mud brick, she is worried that water will get in and spoil her belongings.

Her dream is to own a store so she can stop working in the fields and spend more time working from home.

loans.use: buy wood, tiles, and iron sheeting, and to pay for workers to repair the roof on her house

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is mother of four (two girls and two sons). She works at one of the local restaurants as a waitress. Besides her work in restaurant, Anahit is also employed in the Oriflame cosmetics company business. 

For more than  three years already, Anahit has efficiently implemented her trade. Despite her busy schedule, Anahit is continuously working on herself to be qualified worker and find a well paid job.  She has now applied for this loan to pay for participation in training and purchase cosmetics for reselling to her customers. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for participation in training and purchase cosmetics for reselling to customers

loans.name: Ezron's Group

texts.en:
Ezron, pictured above, has been a farmer for 15 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. He is 44 years old, married and has seven children.

Ezron likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learned a lot from farming trainings. Ezron plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Ezron’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen , 53 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Perveen  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen  is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. For providing her family with the better standard of living, she has been running an animal sale and purchase business for many years. She is working hard to generate good amount of income. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She expects a boost in her earnings through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez  is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children. 

In order to support the needs of the family, her husband ( also shown in the photo) began the business of milk selling. He is known in her town for providing good quality milk and earns enough to contribute to the family income. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to purchase another buffalo to inflate sales for generating more income to cover their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate sales for generating more income to cover their daily expenses.

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher is the group leader of his group in Webuye District, and he is representing fourteen farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of four children. Christopher joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for ten years.

Like many other farmers, Christopher decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

Christopher's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 14 solar lights, as, even though Christopher decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Peninnah's Group

texts.en:
Peninnah is 36 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Peninnah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family, and although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Peninnah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Peninnah's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Teut's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Srey Snom district, Teut is 50 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are still dependent on her. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and pig raising. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR 16,000 to support her family and she can save about KHR 4,000 per day for future needs.

This is the fourth loan for Teut with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and plow the fields. She hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plow the fields.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband by purchasing a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Roepchand

texts.en:
Roepchand feels very good and happy with the help from the Kiva lenders. He again thanks them for their effort and love they give people who truly need it.

He repaid his loan fully and with the profits he was able to overhaul his tractor for the coming seasons. For the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides, Roepchand wants to borrow SRD 12,500 so he can continue his rice cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy solar home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a poly tank and store water for her water vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car for the transport of his tools.

loans.name: Cesilia

texts.en: Cesilia has been married 20 years and she is mother of three children that are going to school. Cesilia sells milk and she makes cheese to make some money. Her husband is a mason. Cesilia needs a loan because she needs to buy a milking cow. Her husband can’t help her, so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Un padre de familia honrado y generoso es Manuel, él tiene 33 años de edad vive junto a su linda familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel se ha dedicado desde hace 8 años a la compra y venta de abarrotería en el lugar de su domicilio, el realiza este pequeño negocio con el único objetivo de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia.
Desde hace algún tiempo Manuel ha tenido la iniciativa de mejorar su tienda, pero dentro de sus posibilidades no contaba con suficiente dinero para poder surtir mejor la tienda, Manuel ahora se ha decidido para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de productos como: arroz aceite, recitos, dulces, refrescos, para abastecer las necesidades de la clientela.
Manuel sueña con poder construir su casa, y comprar una motocicleta para facilitar su movilización.
texts.en:
Manuel is the father of a respectable and generous family.  He is 33 years old and he lives with his lovely family in the community of Sololá.

Manual has made a living for 8 years buying and selling groceries in a spot in his home.  He has his small business with the sole purpose of obtaining income and supporting his family. 

For some time now Manuel has had the initiative to improve his store but he doesn’t have enough money within his means to be able to better stock the store.  Manuel has decided now to request a loan that he will invest in the purchase of products like: rice, oil, snacks, sweets and soft drinks to supply the needs of his clientele.

Manuel dreams of being able to build his house and to buy a motorcycle to make transportation easier.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, snacks, sweets and soft drinks for his store.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 52 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Everlyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Everlyne also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Everlyne's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him get enough income to educate his children and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Solution for her embroidery business and increase her productive hours.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a Solar Solution for her business to increase her income.

loans.name: Faaifo

texts.en: Faaifo is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells samoan-made chips in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Faaifo needs a loan to buy a bunch of bananas, barrels of cooking oil, a large burner, a gas bottle and large pots. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faaifo became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a bunch of bananas, barrels of cooking oil, a large burner, a gas bottle and large pots

loans.name: Guli

texts.en:
Guli is a doctor living in a small town. She is married, and she has two children. Her husband is a seller. She is an educated and bright woman. Her daughters are also studying in medical universities abroad. Her eldest daughter wants to become an eye doctor. 

It is hard for Guli and her husband to pay the tuition for their elder daughter’s studies because the university where she studying, requires  annual payment. She is needed for financial support to pay the tuition of her daughter’s education. 

Guli is asking Kiva for a $1,460 USD loan to pay the tuition of her daughter’s studies at university.

loans.use: to pay a tuition of daughter's university

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray is 52 years old and married with two children. He has a small plantation where he grows taro that he can sell in his community or at the market. He has been doing this for 12 years. Ray needs a loan to buy new boots, chemicals, fertilizer, a machete, crops and a crowbar. 

He has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Ray will use the profits from his sales to pay for his family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, chemicals, fertilizer, a machete, crops and a crowbar

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Linda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her restaurant business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and has six children.  Melanie is married and has five children who are in school.

Melanie is raising pig in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melanie has been raising pig for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, and to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Erlyn requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Erlyn has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from food vending. In the future, Erlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish for her dried-fish-making business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years. Cecilia earns more income from buy and sell fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Darwin Otoniel

texts.es:
Darwin, logro surtir mejor la tienda de productos de primera necesidad con la ayuda del crédito anterior, tiene nuevos clientes y está percibiendo mejores ganancias que son de utilidad para dar a su familia una alimentación, vestuario y salud de mejor calidad.
Para cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo financiamiento con el que comprara azúcar, sal, frijoles, arroz, aceite, bebidas, cereales, etc., con ello sus clientes se mantendrán satisfechos y él continuara teniendo una fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Darwin was able to acquire more inventory for his basic provisions store with the help of his previous loan.  He has new customers and is generating more income.  With his profits, he is able to provide his family with better quality food, clothes, and health care.  

In order to meet the new demands from his customers, Darwin decided to request a new loan so that he can buy sugar, salt, beans, rice, beverages, cereals, and other products.  With these proceeds, he can keep his customers satisfied and continue to have a source of income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, rice, beverages, cereals, and other products.

loans.name: Hesron

texts.en:
Hesron is 25 years old, married, and the father of a two-year-old. He is a farmer with many years of experience who grows rice, and his wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, Hesron would like to buy fertilizers for his rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Tabu operates a stall selling groceries and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
38-year-old Sopheap is a wife and a mother of three. The five of them are living together in a rural village of Stoeng Sen district in Kampong Thom province. All of her children are studying in secondary school.

To finance the family, Sopheap has been farming rice for ten years, and she is able to save around 4 USD per day. Sopheap has been a member with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles now, and currently, she is a leader of her group of four.

Sopheap is seeking a loan of 400,000 KHR to build a toilet. She believes it will improve the family’s hygiene.

loans.use: to build a toilet

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
"Beatrice, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by seven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Beatrice will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Beatrice plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Beatrice’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Mia. 

Mia lives in East Serang, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only son. 

Mia joined Ruma in 2013, and this is the second time she has asked for a loan through Kiva. She feels that since joining Ruma, she has been able to help her husband to improve their lives, and she is learning a lot about how to start up a business and make a better contribution to her community. 

As the business grows, Mia is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends.

Your loan will be very useful and important in helping Mia to improve her business and therefore, her community, who need access to such services. 

Mia is standing in the photo. She will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée et âgée de 33 ans, elle habite dans le quartier de Lomé. Avec deux enfants à sa charge, Ablavi s’active dynamiquement pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Ablavi vend de la pate bandée et des poissons dans son restaurant et arrive à gagner son profit grâce à cette activité. Ablavi achète ses provisions une fois par mois et sollicite ce prêt pour commander quelques sacs de  maïs et un carton de poissons.
texts.en: Ablavi is a married woman, aged 33, who lives in the Lomé district. With two children to support, she is energetic in meeting the needs of her family. She sells “pate bandée” and fish in her restaurant and manages to earn a profit, thanks to this business. Ablavi purchases her provisions once a month and is requesting this loan to order a few sacks of corn and a box of fish.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn and a box of fish

loans.name: Shan Su Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Shan Su Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of 18 (eight male and ten female) village customers, of whom five are CBO (Community Based Organization) members helping to lead the loan program in the area. 

This loan will help some group members to purchase high-quality feeds (costing $80 for the amount of 100 ducks' feed) that will boost their income from more duck eggs. The other members will use the funds to repair the duck farm (costing $40 or $50 for a 100-duck farm) which needs to be exchanged every year. 

Shan Su Village mostly focuses on farming and plantation of seasonal vegetables and nipa palms. Besides these, they also raise pigs, ducks and chickens. While in the home the whole day, some housewives both sort out the house chores and open small grocery shops in front of their houses.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Shan Su Village, named San, Tin, Zaw, Than and Aye. San, in the middle in the picture, is 42 years old and a housewife. She is married, and her husband farms in their twenty-acre crop farm. The couple is proud having a son who is going to finish high school in a year.

Proximity's loan helps her to purchase ducks and also high-quality feed that will make the ducks be more energetic and lay more. With more eggs,San's family will have a boost in their income.

loans.use: To help the Shan Su Village in repairing the duck's farm and purchase high quality feed

loans.name: Pyapon Taman Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Pyapon Taman Village, which has a population of over 600, in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members (all of them are males) are overseeing a group of twenty village customers (thirteen male and seven female).
This loan will support this community in purchasing high-quality feed (duck food and packets of shrimp), which will last one month for a hundred ducks. The main income in the village is mainly farming and livestock such as pigs and ducks. 
Pictured above are the CBO members from Pyapon Taman Group 2. They are named  Aye,  Zaw,  Htwe, Zaw, and Kyi. 
Included in the picture, U Aye (first from right), is forty-five years old and married with three children. Two of Aye's children are students, and one helps him farm. Aye farms his seven-acre crop farm and looks after the livestock as well. 
The loans from Proximity would help him to purchase high-quality feed for his 150 ducks. This usage will help Aye's family boost their income from more ducks’ eggs.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality feed.

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah, is a 39 year old housewife whose daily work is raising pigs, working in the garden and taking care of her family. Ni Nengah is very grateful to get a special loan for raising pigs because her efforts have been proven to help provide for her family. As the head of the Kembang Kertas group, she is responsible for the repayment of the entire loan.

To further improve the results of their businesses raising pigs, Kembang Kertas group agreed to continue borrowing. Their current loan will be used to repair cages, buy feed and superior quality piglets.

Ni Nengah will use her portion of the loan to buy super quality piglets. Due to the relatively high feed prices, Ni Nengah is assisted by her husband. Ni Nengah will save all the profit from this effort and will use it as working capital so that she will not need to borrow again.

loans.use: to buy super quality piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy commercial feed for her dairy cattle and increase milk production to supply to the market to sell.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
"Wilson is 54 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Wilson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Wilson also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Wilson's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
This is Fatuma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more vegetables for her grocery business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for Kes 30,000, to purchase more green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help Fatuma to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to help her to expand the business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 41-year-old farmer who is always deferential to the people he meets. Richard comes from a small village called Roret which is found in the South Rift Province of Kenya. He is a dairy farmer. His main income source is milk.

Richard is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to construct a cowshed. He has three dairy cows that lack shelter. As a consequence, they are exposed to harsh weather changes.

However, with your loan investment, Richard will use the money to construct a cowshed for his cows. The housing will offer comfort and protection to the farm animals. The shelter will also pave the way to introduction of zero-grazing, or confined, feeding. This will have a significant boost to milk production quantities, because the cows will use the energy that they would have otherwise used to wander in search for pasture, to manufacture milk.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Grace will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Grace plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total, Grace’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Malititi - Masaka Bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Safura is a 57-year-old hardworking woman from Bimbilla in the northern region of Ghana. Safura is married and has six children. Safura is the individual pictured with her hand raised among members sitting.

Safura is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 12 years. The name of the group is "Malititi - Masaka Bimbilla." Safura earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local market and for the export market.

Safura and "Malititi - Masaka Bimbilla" have asked for a loan of GHS 12,450. Safura’s share of the loan is GHS 500, which would be used to buy shea nuts for butter processing. Safura aspires to earn more income and expand her business, as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and school fees.

Safura thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for butter processing.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 49-years-old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.  Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a lovely and hardworking 51-year-old rural farmer from Shamata village in Kenya. She is a single mother of three children. Mercy started farming seven years ago from scratch to provide for her family. Today, she owns a four-acre piece of land that she uses to keep three dairy cows and five heads of poultry. She also grows vegetables and other food crops on her farm. 

Mercy is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES to pay for farm inputs. Her farm is already ploughed and ready for planting season, scheduled on rain onset. She is going to use the loan money to pay for inputs such as labour, seeds, and fertilizer. She will make initial loan repayments using income from dairy sales as she waits for the crops to mature for harvesting. Income from this investment will be used to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 37-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. In 1998, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own home business. She’s a tailor. Her husband represents the main income source of the family.

Today, she is asking to borrow a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase an electric sewing machine and better improve her business, and therefore, her revenue. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Atangcho

texts.en:
Atangcho is married with six children and lives in a seven-room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life, like accidents, sickness, the death of her father, and inadequate finances for medication and the education of her children.

With the new loan she requested, she will buy coco yams and yam seedlings, rent a piece of land, extend a pig sty, and buy more piglets and chicks. She will also buy feed for the animals. She is very optimistic that her business will succeed because she is full of experience in this domain of agriculture, coupled with the fact that demand is extremely high.

The community will benefit from her moderate sales prices, and they will not run short of food since she has the capital to provide enough food for the community. The distance it takes to buy elsewhere will be reduced, thus saving time and cash for other purposes. Also, manure would be available at any convenient time.

The profit made from this business will be used to educate Atangcho's children, extend her farmland, and cater to her family's needs.

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of their lower interest rate, and because they do not ask for security collateral and payment is not stressful. This is also coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services including training in leadership skills, communication skills, and social networking during bi-monthly center meetings.

loans.use: to buy coco yams and yam seedlings, rent a piece of land, extend a pig sty, and buy more piglets, chicks, and more feed for her animals.

location.town: mile 8 mankon Bamenda North West Region

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution for her business and generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby at the market. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 80,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
"Gladys is 43 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by seven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Gladys has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Gladys also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Gladys's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zelphater's Group

texts.en:
"Zelphater is 52 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Zelphater has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Zelphater also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Zelphater's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Edith Amparo

texts.es: Edith de 45 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos  desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edith, 45 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter. She has worked growing basic grains for ten years. She sells her products in the surrounding area of the zone where she lives. With the earnings that she obtains she is able to cover some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, manure, infestation control, herbicide, etc. and to improve the land that the photo shows and in that way have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, manure, infestation control, herbicide, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal Mainique de Urubamba.
El socio Jose Alberto  es soltero, el socio alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales agregados como arena, piedras entre otros, él socio  lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales agregados.
El socio se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Jose Alberto belongs to the communal bank Mainique de Urubamba. Jose Alberto is single, he balancess his daily activities with a business selling construction materials such as sand and rocks and stones. 

Jose Alberto has been making a living with this business for a decent amount of time. Thanks to Jose Alberto's daily determination, his business is going well. He would like to keep working in this business to support himself to move forward. 

Jose Alberto is seeking a loan to buy construction materials. He feels very grateful for the offered loan and he is committed to meeting his established repayments.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to get income to start a grocery business.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is a father of two children who are still attending school. Khodor is the main income provider in his family. In 2004, he opened a barber shop. To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. 

He will use the loan to buy a motor for his shop, which he needs to continue operating. He expects an increase in his income, as he is expanding his work, and he hopes that his business will grow. He dreams of being able to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his barber shop

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is a 29-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He has his own business as a blacksmith. Nadine started working as a private teacher in 2013 and she works in parallel in a local laboratory as a nurse. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students and equipped it with required materials and supplies. Today, Nadine is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a car to help her in her work. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a car to help her in her work.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
"Violet, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Violet will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Violet plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Violet’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Blanca Susana

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con una hija y una nieta en casa de su ex esposo, desde hace mucho tiempo por necesidad de cubrir gastos de su hogar decidió dedicarse a vender pupusas, comida y bebidas, el oficio lo aprendió por sí misma, un nieto le ayuda a atender el negocio.
Comprará harina, aceite, verduras, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas, azúcar, sal, etc., de esa manera continuara elaborando la venta de pupusas, comida y bebidas, al tener al por mayor la materia prima pagara un precio bajo y así sus ganancias serán mayores, espera resarcir su deuda lo más pronto posible.
Los objetivos de Blanca son lograr trabajar con capital propio y compartir con su familia un mejor entorno.
texts.en: Blanca lives with her daughter and granddaughter in her ex-husband's house. For a long time and in order to cover her household's expenses, she decided to sell pupusas, food, and beverages. She learned the job by herself, with a grandson that helps her attend the business.  She will buy flour, cooking oil, vegetables, beans, cottage cheese, pork rinds, beverages, sugar, salt, etc. Thus, she will continue making pupusas, food and beverages for sale. Having access to the wholesale inputs, she will be able to pay lower prices and get bigger earnings. She hopes to payback her loan as soon as possible. Blanca's objectives are to be able to have her own working capital and share with her family in a better environment.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil, vegetables, beans, cottage cheese, pork rinds, beverages, sugar, salt. etc, thus to continue preparing pupusas, food and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Sara Elisa

texts.es: Sara está casada, tiene 33 años de edad y tiene  una hija de 11 años que asiste a la escuela, Sara vive con su hija y su esposo que trabaja de albañil, Sara se dedica a la crianza de vaconas y también trabaja de costurera, Sara necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de vaconas, Sara tiene  la aspiración mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando duro para mejorar sus ingresos y junto a sus esposo reunir  algún capital para a futuro comprar una casita y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is 33 years old, married, and has an 11-year-old daughter who is in school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Sara raises cows and also works as a seamstress. She needs the money from the loan so that she can invest in the purchase of cows.

Sara has aspirations of improving her business and continuing to work hard so that she can improve her income. She and her husband are saving up some capital so that they can buy a house in the future in order to improve their family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has two children, ages 10 and 14. She describes herself to be faithful and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land and open more businesses.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Angel Jonathan

texts.es:
Ángel, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, no tiene hijo. 

Ángel, se dedica a hacer pan desde hace más de 5 años, inicio este trabajo por medio de una amiga, que lo motivo a que iniciara su propio negocio; antes que el iniciara esta actividad, se dedicaba a la agricultura.- Ángel, tiene que salir a comercializarlo en su motocicleta, su hermano le ayuda a elaborarlo, trabajan todos los días.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar harina, azúcar, canela y huevos para hacer el pan, también necesita reparar su motocicleta porque le está fallando, de esta manera él genera los ingresos necesarios para su pareja y sus padres. 

Su mayor sueño es tener su negocio bien establecido, tener mayor cantidad de hornos e independizarse de sus padres, pero siempre ayudarlos económicamente.
texts.en: Angel, who is 27 years old, studied up to first year of high school. He has a domestic partner, and she works in household chores. He does not have any children. Angel has been working making bread for more than 5 years. He started this job because of a friend who motivated him to start his own business. Before this activity, he used to work in farming. Angel has to go sell it on his motorcycle. His brother helps him to prepare it. They work every day. He needs the loan to buy flour, sugar, cinnamon and eggs to prepare bread. He also needs to fix his motorcycle, because it is not working well, This is how he generates the needed income for his partner and his parents. His biggest dream is to have a well established business, to have more ovens, and to be independent from his parents, but to always help them financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cinnamon and eggs to prepare bread; and also to repair his motorcycle because it is not working well.

loans.name: Murumba's Group

texts.en:
Murumba is 60 years old and has 10 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group of 14 farmers from Webuye District, Kenya. 

Murumba has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Murumba also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Murumba's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, insecticide and other items assist her coffee plants.

loans.name: Wilkister's Group

texts.en:
Wilkister is a 50-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Wilkister has learned a lot from farming training.

Wilkister described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate in.

With this loan, Wilkister’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children. When asked, she described herself as honest.

For the past four years Alice has sold fruits and vegetables to make a living. Her business is located in a busy area where she has all sorts of customers. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital.

Alice is applying for a first loan through SMEP Microfinance Bank. She is requesting 20,000 KES to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is Josephine, 44, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent and has a child who is still in elementary school. She works hard to support herself and her only child.

For 10 years, Josephine has been in the food business. She makes and sells Filipinos' favorite snacks such as "kamote-cue" (skewered deep fried sweet potatoes with a coating of caramelized brown sugar), "maruya" or Banana Fritter (fried sliced or mashed "saba" bananas mixed with a batter of flour, sugar, vanilla, and a binder), "turon" (caramelized banana spring rolls) and of course "lugaw" (Filipino version of congee). She earns a minimun of 1,000 PHP a day in sales.

To help her maintain her business, Josephine is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy bananas, sugar, oil, flour, and rice needed to cook kamote-cue, maruya, turon, and lugaw to sell at her stall. She is thanking God in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. Her earnings will surely help in their daily sustenance and for her child's education.

Josephine dreams to be more successful and someday have her own small eatery. She prays for a better future for her and her child. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy bananas, sugar, rice, flour, and eggs to cook snacks to sell.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina, vive con sus hijos, es casada, su negocio consiste en un tienda de productos de la canasta básica, la pose desde hace tres años, en ese entonces su inventario no estaba tan surtido, pero ha sabido administrar sus ganancias y actualmente ofrece una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes, por lo que estos prefieren visitar su negocio.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar cereales, pastas, jabón, legía, bebidas, pan, entre otros productos para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, pretende incrementar sus ventas y ganancias para ir progresando y cancelar sus deudas.
Sus sueños son brindar una vida con menos necesidades a su familia y formar un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina lives with her children and is married. Her business consists of a store of basic products. She has owned it for three years. In those days her inventory wasn’t very well supplied, but she has known to manage her earnings and she currently offers a wide variety of products to her customers, which is why they prefer to visit her business. 

She will use the loan to buy cereal, pasta, soap, bleach, drinks, bread, among other products to satisfy the demands of her customers. She plans to increase her sales and earnings to progress and settle her debts. 

Her dreams are to provide her family a life with fewer needs and to form a patrimony for her children.

loans.use: to buy cereal, pasta, soap, bleach, drinks, bread, among other products to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Maira Rosibel

texts.es:
Maira, de 39 años de edad, por la falta de recursos económicos solo estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera de dos niñas.

Maira, se dedica a la venta de pupusa, pero debido a que cambio de domicilio, no lo tiene funcionando, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio, antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos.
 
Maira, necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima y una refrigeradora para iniciar con su negocio nuevamente.
 
Su deseo es que todo le salga bien en el negocio, así como también que sus hijos sigan estudiando, para que sean profesionales y así mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Maira, 39, only studied up to the third grade due to a lack of economic resources.  She is a single mother of two daughters.
Maira makes a living from the sale of pupusas (stuffed tortillas), but because she moved, she has not been working.  She has been doing this work for seven years.  Before she only did housework.
Maira needs the loan to buy raw materials and a refrigerator to restart her business.
Her wish is that all goes well with her business as well as that her children continue to study so they can become professionals and in this way improve their economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and a refrigerator to restart her business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in her business.

Mary is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to boost her kiosk, to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Suglo Nbori Buni-Bagurugu Group

texts.en:
Fuseina is a 40 year-old hard working woman from Bagurugu, in the Northern region of Ghana. Fuseina is married and has 4 children. Fuseina is the individual pictured with her hand raised sitting in front.

Fuseina is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 7 years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo Nbori Buni-Bagurugu'. Fuseina earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local market and for export market.

Fuseina and ‘Suglo Nbori Buni-Bagurugu’ have asked for a loan of GHS 13,200. Fuseina’s share of the loan is GHS 500 which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing. Fuseina aspires to earn more income, expand her business as well as to repay this loan and support her children’s food and school fees.

Fuseina thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Gub'danda - Tampion Group

texts.en:
Awabu is a 40- year-old hard working woman from Tampion in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has 5 children Awabu is the individual pictured raising a hand among members squatting.

Awabu is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 20 years. The name of the group is ‘Gub'danda - Tampion’. Awabu earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana and Planet Finance on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Awabu and ‘Gub'danda - Tampion’ have asked for a loan of GHS 3,800. Awabu’s share of the loan is GHS 300 which will help her to buy shea nuts for processing. Awabu aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and buy washing soap and food for her children.

Awabu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Bourama

texts.fr: Bourama est un malien âgé de 31ans alphabétisé. Marié, père de deux (2) enfants dont un est à l’école coranique, sa femme fait le petit commerce. Il fait le stockage de céréales, il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et revend dans les mêmes marchés. Il fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter plus de sacs de céréales à stocker afin d’avoir plus de profits. Le profit de Bourama lui permet de prendre en charge les frais de médicaments de ses enfants, la nourriture, l’habillement …etc. Apres la vente du stock, Bourama peut gagner comme profits 4000FCFA par sacs. Bourama rencontre souvent les problèmes de méventes. Dans l’avenir, Bourama  souhaite avoir un prêt plus élevé pour développer son activité  en construisant un grand magasin de stockage pour bien améliorer son activité de stockage.
texts.en: Bourama is a 31-year-old man from Mali.  He is literate, married, and the father of two (2) children, one of whom attends Koranic school.  Bourama's wife works in small retail.  Bourama himself makes a living storing grains.  He stocks up from local markets and then resells his goods at the same markets.  He has turned to Kiva's partner, the RMCR, in order to store more bags of grains and increase his profits.  Thanks to his earnings, Bourama is able to cover his children's medication, food and clothing expenses.  He makes a profit of 4,000 CFA francs per bag at resale.  However, he often faces challenges such as poor sales.  In the future, he would like to get a bigger loan, which will allow him to build a large storage shop and develop his storage activity.

loans.use: to buy bags of grains for storage and resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with two children. When asked, she described herself as experienced.

For the past twelve years Nelly has been involved in a carpentry business where she makes furniture to sell. Her business is located in a strategic spot, and she primarily sells to locals. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital.

This will be Alice’s seventh loan through SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loans were all repaid successfully. She is now asking for 50,000 KES to buy more furniture-grade wood. She hopes that the future holds success for herself.

loans.use: to buy more furniture-grade wood.

loans.name: Olga Adriana

texts.es:
Olga, vive con su esposo de 70 años, quien es pensionado, ella se dedica a vender sandalias y chancletas para  adultos y niños/as, sus hijos son independientes y en ocasiones les ayudan económicamente, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de su localidad.
Invertirá en sandalias, chancletas y zapatos, diversificados en colores, estilos y tallas, ofrecerá nuevo producto a sus clientes para obtener mejores ingresos y de esa forma ser puntual con el pago de su deuda.
Olga sueña con seguir trabajando para tener un mejor bienestar con su familia.
texts.en:
Olga lives with her 70-year old husband, who is retired. Her children live independently and sometimes they help out financially. Olga makes her living selling sandals and flip-flops for adults and children. Her business is located in her neighborhood's market.

Olga will invest in sandals, flip-flops and shoes in a variety of colors, styles and sizes so she can offer her customers new products. This will help her to earn a better income, which in turn will allow her to punctually pay off her loan.

Olga wants to continue working so her family can enjoy improved well-being.

loans.use: to invest in sandals, flip-flops and shoes in a variety of colors, styles and sizes so she can offer new products to her customers.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, el crédito anterior le ha permitido tener cosechas abundantes y sanas de esta manera alimenta mejor a los miembros de su familia y ha generado nuevos ingresos, aún conserva la tienda de productos varios.
Su negocio es más rentable, considerando que no tiene un inventario capaz de cubrir dichas demandas se ha decidió por un nuevo financiamiento para comprar cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos y luego venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
The previous loan permitted Ernesto to have abundant and healthy harvests and in this way feed the members of his family better.  He has generated new income and even stocked the shop with various products.
His business is more profitable.  Considering that he doesn't have an inventory capable of covering such demands, he has decided to get a new loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed to feed them with and later sell them at a better price in the market.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed to feed them with and later sell them at a better price in the market.

loans.name: Sabunyuman N°2 Group

texts.fr:
ALY est le monsieur  qui à la main sur le Bœuf sur la photo.
ALY est un malien âgé de 55 ans, il n’a pas été à l’école.
Il est marié, père de 7 enfants, 2 garçons et 5 filles. Les enfants sont âgés de 7 à 20 ans et fréquentent tous l’école coranique. Sa femme fait le  commerce de poissons.
 ALY fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité d’embouche. Il fait l’embouche bovine depuis 3 ans. Il s’approvisionne sur le marché de la localité et revend dans le même marché. Après-vente il peut gagner 50 000 FCFA de profit. Le Profit lui   permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses de sa famille. Le prêt du RMCR l’a beaucoup encouragé dans son activité. Il rencontre souvent des problèmes de mévente sur le marché. Dans l’avenir, il veut avoir un prêt plus élevé pour pouvoir ajouter d’autres activités (commerce de poisson, la pêche) à l’embouche bovine.
texts.en:
Aly is the man with his hand on the ox in the photo. Aly is 55 years old and a native of Mali.  He never went to school.  He is married and the father of seven children (two boys and five girls).  His children's ages range between 7 and 20 and all of them go to Koranic school.  Aly's wife sells fish.

Aly has turned to Kiva's partner, the RMCR, in order to carry out his livestock fattening activity.  He has been involved in this activity for three years.  He buys livestock at the local market and resells his animals at the same market.  He makes a profit of up to 50,000 CFA francs at resale.  Thanks to his profits, he is able to cover his family's expenses.  He has been really encouraged by loans from the RMCR, but he still faces challenges such as poor sales at the market.

In the future, he would like to receive a larger loan so that he can add other activities (fish sales, fishing) to his livestock fattening activity.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
"Catherine, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Catherine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Catherine plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Catherine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en: Twaha is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will own a larger shop. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia  con su grupo familiar, ella cuenta con un negocio de tienda desde hace 3 años, con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo las paredes principales ya que están hechas de laminas que es la que muestra en la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para La compra de ladrillos, arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra y así ella y su familia puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en:
Maria, 35, lives in her own house with her family group.  For three years, she has had a business of a shop.  With the earnings she obtains, she has been able to come out ahead.  
She wants to improve her residence by constructing the main walls since they are made of corrugated tin which can be seen in the photograph, but she doesn't have the capital to do it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase bricks, sand, cement, rebar, and payment for the labor and thus her family will be able to live more securely.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, rebar, and payment for the labor.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria una estudiante de 18 años de edad es soltera. Ella actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de administración bancaria, está en el quinto ciclo de la carrera se siente feliz al poder continuar sus estudios y seguir creciendo profesionalmente. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para el pago de su pensión de estudio y matricula.  Actualmente Maria trabaja en una empresa como asesora de ventas lo que le permite cubrir una parte de sus estudios y la de su familia. El deseo de Maria es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y poner su propia empresa .Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyarla con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria, an 18 year old student, is single. She is currently studying for a career in banking administration. She's in a fifth cycle of the degree and is happy about being able to continue her studies and continue growing professionally. 

Because of this, she's seeking a loan to pay for her room and board for school, and tuition. Right now, Maria works in a business as a sales assessor, which allows her to cover part of her tuition and her family. 

Maria's desire is to finish her degree and start her own business. She thanks the Kiva lenders for supporting her with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition and room and board for studies.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: SAFOURA est la cliente qui tient la calebasse de riz en main. Agée de 46 ans, Safoura est une commerçante malienne, veuve mère de sept (07) enfants tous écoliers. Elle a fréquenté l’école coranique. Safoura s’approvisionne au niveau des foires hebdomadaires environnantes. Avec son prêt  reçu de RMCR, elle a utilisé une partie pour acheter  de céréales (mil et riz) pour les stocker et le restant est utilisé pour faire le petit commerce (de riz,  grain, patate, igname). Safoura vend ses céréales (stocks) aux mêmes marchés environnants. Elle peut avoir des bénéfices variables entre 20 000 à 25 000F par cycle. Safoura fait le commerce depuis plus de dix(10) ans ; Mais grâce aux prêts du RMCR son activité prospére beaucoup. Safoura n’a pas de difficulté pour le déroulement de ses activités mais elle sollicite un prêt un peu élevé pour diversifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Safoura is the lady who is holding a calabash full of rice in her hands.  She is a 46-year-old retailer and a native of Mali.  She is widowed and the mother of seven children who all attend school.  Safoura herself went to Koranic school.  

Safoura buys her goods at the local weekly markets. She will be using part of her loan received from the RMCR to buy some grains (millet and rice) and to store them.  The rest of the money will be used to buy and sell rice, grains, potatoes and yams.  Safoura resells her stocks of grains at the same local markets.  She makes a profit of up to 20,000 or 25,000 CFA francs per cycle.

Safoura has been involved in retail for more than ten years and she has been able to grow her business thanks to loans from the RMCR.  She has no particular difficulty running her business, but she's requesting a somewhat large loan in order to diversify her retail activity.

loans.use: to buy grains for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.en:
Youssouf is the man with his hands on a bag of rice, in the photo.  He is 44 years old and a native of Mali.  He didn't attend school.  He is the father of nine children whose ages range between 6 and 20.  Three of his children are in school.  His wife sells rice in order to meet her own small needs.

Youssouf makes a living storing grains and fattening livestock.  He has been involved in these activities for the past 15 years.  He has turned to Kiva's partner, the RMCR, in order to have some money to buy many bags of grains and some sheep.  Thanks to this loan, he will increase his profits and will be able to cover his children's school fees, healthcare costs and clothing needs.  He stocks up at local markets and resells at another, more distant, market.  He often faces challenges such as poor sales, but problems tend to take care of themselves over time.  In the near future, he would like to take a larger loan in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy grains for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a lamp, mirrors and makeup.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a battery-charging business. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more batteries. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big battery business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more batteries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products.

loans.name: Munay Tika Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia ella es separada y tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos e productos como arroz ,azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de et forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite entre otros.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de fruta.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to "Munay Tika" communal bank.  This bank is located in district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.
The partner is Lidia, 28, who is separated and has one son.  She works at her sales business of a grocery store.  The partner has been having good times with her business which goes well because of the effort she puts in her business every day.  She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, and milk amongst other things.  She wants to continue working in order to continue to support her family.
The partner is requesting a loan to buy rice and oil amongst other things.
The other partners make a living from an agricultural business, a vegetable sales business, and a fruit sales business.
The partner thanks those who are part of her dream by this means and promises to comply with the repayment terms on time.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil amongst other things.

loans.name: Kisoga Group

texts.en:
Angela is in in her early 30's and is married with three children who are still in school.  She has been running a genge (grocery store) business for three years now.  She works from 6:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Angela's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase her genge stock and meet her customers' demands.  She dreams of expanding her business.

Angela will share this loan with her loan group "Kisoga," which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her genge (grocery store) stock and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are factory buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more touch lights and bulbs for resale

loans.name: Mohamed  S

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has two children, aged 42 and 39. In 2010, Mohamed established his rice, sugar and Maggi (a seasoning product) business. He began his business because he is now a retired tanker driver.  His son opened the business for him.  His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are men and women.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 to buy more bags of rice, sugar and Maggi.
