He hopes that this loan will support him to increase his stock level. In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his children and to seek more funds from ARD to complete the construction of his house.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, Maggi (a seasoning product), etc.

loans.name: Abubakarr

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Abubakarr.  He is single and has one child, aged 3. In 2014, Abubakarr established his mobile accessories, charger, earphone, memory stick, and phone battery business. He was dropped out of school and decided to do business just to engage himself in an economic activity.  His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are men and women.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more mobile accessories such as chargers for resale. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level.  In the future, Abubakarr plans to educate his children and to seek more funds from ARD.  He also wants to complete the construction of his house.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories for resale

loans.name: Elina Rosario

texts.es:
Elina tiene 48 años de edad es soltera tiene 3 hijos y vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas ya que se dedica a la agricultuta y gracias al credito podra mejorar en lo que es la siembra de maiz y darle el mantenimiento adecuado para obtener un mayor ingreso ya que es madre soltera y necesita para mantener a sus 3 hijos. Su sueño es comprarse un carro para pasearse con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elina, 48, is single, has three children, and lives in Ventanas, Los Rios Province.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies since she makes a living in agriculture.  Thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her corn crop and give it adequate maintenance in order to obtain better income since she is a single mother and needs it to maintain her three children.  Her dream is to buy a car to drive around with her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies for planting.

loans.name: Safiatu

texts.en:
Safiatu is 38 years old, single and has no children. In 2013, Safiatu established her drinks and provisions business. She was unfortunate to further her education when her brother introduced her in to business at an early stage and as she grew up she decided to take it as a career.  Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are both men and women.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,900,000 Sierra Leone Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 Sierra Leone Leone (SLL). Safiatu requires a loan in order to buy more crates of drinks and cartons of milk, cheese, sardines, paste and sweets for resale.  She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the level of her additional income.  In the future, she plans to be a wholesale businesswoman to supply goods to people.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of milk, cheese, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stocks of fish for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: buy stocks of fish for resale

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Dauda.  He is married, and has two children aged 5 years and 10 years old. In 2014, Dauda established his transportation business. He began his business through his brother. His business is located at the outskirts of the city and his main customers are the general public. Working 6 days a week, 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,0000 Sierra Leone Leone (SLL) every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 Sierra Leone Leone (SLL) in order to buy more spare parts for his minibus. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his business level. In the future, Dauda plans to educate his children onto the university level and to seek more funds from ARD. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for his minibus

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a young, determined business owner from northern Israel. She owns a butcher shop and deli in her village and has worked hard to make it a success. Over the last several months, as her business has grown, Amna has been working to balance her customers and fit them into her business. 

She needed this loan to make renovations, add additional sinks, tables, tiling, a small freezer and supplies.

She has worked hard to get her business to where it is and is determined to have it move from strength to strength. Amna’s place is the only one of its kind in the area. There is a large demand for her products and one day she wants to expand to a regional store.

loans.use: to renovate, add additional sinks, tables, tiling, a small freezer and supplies.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is studying literature. She needed this loan to assist in paying for her tuition and to assist her in continuing her studies.

Sanaa is an excellent student who has every opportunity to succeed with an education. This small loan is helping her to do so.

loans.use: to obtain a student loan for higher education

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.en:
Vyacheslav is married and has a 7-year-old son. He works at a train station on a duty post. Also, Vyacheslav is a builder. Together with his team they do repairs and construction work.

Vyacheslav lives with his family in a house. But this autumn a fire destroyed a big part of it.  Vyacheslav is trying to rebuild the house again.

Vyacheslav is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to do renovations to the kitchen in his house.

loans.use: to rebuild his house after a fire

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 2 Group

texts.en:
Griserda is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Bendecidas (Blessed Women) 2. She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business, and now to be sustainable. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying sharing with her family. 

Griserda is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and having grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, in which she cooks for people, by buying some rice, beans, cooking oils, meats, and other products for food preparation.  It is like a restaurant, and it is in the neighborhood called Comedor.  She sells to neighbors and people working around her neighborhood. 

Griserda's group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She is a very hard worker and an enthusiastic woman, and she thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, meats, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials for her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy additional stocks of cereals. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of cereals

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a poultry farm. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy additional poultry and farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to her expand business.

loans.use: buy additional poultry and farm inputs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a general store where she sells bread, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, soap and other items to resell. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more sugar, bread, soap and other items for resale

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits, vegetables and bed sheets. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are local. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale. She hopes that in the future she will own a large grocery store. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are factory buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future she will expand further. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a married man with 5 children ranging in age from 2 year to 15 years. He describes himself as dedicated and hopeful. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a hair clipper and other barber shop items. His business goal is to open more business branches within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a hair clipper and other barber shop items

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest and faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells furniture. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more furniture to resell. She hopes that in the future she can open more businesses.

loans.use: buy more furniture to resell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Jessie is borrowing 27,000 PHP, through NWTF, to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Jessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 48-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school.  

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF, in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for twelve years, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is an experienced Mexican farmer. She raises goats and sheep, and cultivates corn to produce their forage. She decided to acquire a biodigester in order to become more self-sufficient, by taking advantage of her animals' manure. 

It used to be difficult for Maria Guadalupe to make ends meet between the purchase of expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers, and the time she spent looking for wood in the surrounding areas. With her biodigester, this will all change, and she will displace these costly and unsustainable external inputs. 

Maria Guadalupe will become her own energy and organic fertilizer provider, as she will transform manure into biogas and nutrient-rich fertilizer for her field. She will save money and improve the air quality in her house, as she eliminates the toxic smoke created by burning wood, while also increasing the yield of her corn field in a natural way. 

As the whole family gets used to the biodigester, she plans to expand her little garden to grow more vegetables and diversify her family's diet. Maria Guadalupe wants to use her savings to send her grandchildren to school and university.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part will be covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He is 47 years old, married and works as a market trader. Three years ago. he started with a tissue growth on the surface of the eye. Actually this injury obstructs his sight fields and does not let him develop his work activities in the market because the changes in temperature cause painful episodes. He needs the surgery so he can keep doing his work.

loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Jessilyn

texts.en:
Jessilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP, through NWTF, to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jessilyn successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Jessilyn's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more merchandise and a glass display shelf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron, sheets of metal, beams, etc.

loans.name: Kristoffersen

texts.en: Kristoffersen lives at Tuguegarao with his family. He has two children. He manages an internet shop and grocery store for income. He has been very patient in his business to sustain the needs of the family. He wants to maintain a good flow of income from his business and that is why he is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy grocery items for the store. He will buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks and breads to sell. He promises to pay back his loan in full and keep improving his service as well.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more assorted items for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for six years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vending dried fish.  Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her manicure business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her manicure business.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is 54 years old and a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fermina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Fermina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Fermina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josue Abel

texts.es:
Josué, cultiva granos básicos, cría cerdos y aves de corral, está acompañado, vive en compañía de su pareja y un hijo, ellos dependen de él, lo relacionado con la agricultura lo aprendió de su padre y a trabajado en ello toda su vida, no le ha sido fácil mantener su negocio funcionando, pero lo ha logrado a base de un esfuerzo constante, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am. a 3:00 pm.
Necesita comprar tres silos metálicos, le serán de ayuda para almacenar en mejores condiciones los granos básicos cosechados por mucho más tiempo, de esa manera los venderá cuando alcancen un mejor precio en el mercado.
Sus sueños son incrementar la rentabilidad de su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida que comparte con su familia.
texts.en:
Josué grows basic grains and raises pigs and poultry. He is in a relationship, living in the company of his partner and son; they depend on him. What is related to agriculture he learned from his father and in working in it for all of his life. It has not been easy to keep his business going, but he has succeeded through a constant effort. His work schedule is from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm. 

He needs to buy three metal silos. They will be useful to store the harvested basic grains in better conditions  for much more time. In that way he will sell them when they will fetch a better price in the market. 

His dreams are to increase the profitability of his business and improve the living conditions that he shares with his family.

loans.use: to buy three metal silos, which will be useful to store the harvested grains in better conditions for a lot more time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more welding materials like doors, windows, etc. for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He is 56 years old and married. He was diagnosed with cataracts 10 years ago and chronic renal failure 15 years ago. Currently he undergoes extra blood dialysis. The cataracts prevent him from moving in his house to perform basic tasks such as taking a shower or using the toilet. He needs the surgery to improve his life quality.

loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is a small Mexican farmer who raises sheep, poultry and cultivates corn on a small field close to his house. In parallel to his farming activities, he works as a laborer to complement his monthly income. By investing in a biodigester he hopes to reduce his operating expenses and increase his productivity to focus on the expansion of his farm. Indeed, the biodigester will allow him to displace the expensive LP gas, chemical fertilizers and wood he used to buy and to replace them with the biogas and organic fertilizer he will produce from his animals' waste. In addition to saving money, Gerardo's corn field will yield more as the soil will be nourished with the nutrients from the potent fertilizer. These benefits will be accompanied by health improvements for his family, as Gerardo's wife will not have to inhale the toxic smoke produced by burning wood anymore and will not contribute to deforestation anymore as she cooks and heats water with biogas. Gerardo plans to use his savings to buy additional sheep and maintain his children in school.
This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remainder is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Enrique Alvaro

texts.en:
Enrique is a specialized hog and sheep farmer. He raises and fattens the animals to sell their meat to local suppliers, or he sells it directly to the local community from his little stand outside the farm. He prepares the meat on a barbecue with traditional Mexican tortillas. 

Enrique cultivates the forage for his animals on a large corn field, for which he used to buy expensive chemical fertilizers. He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to take advantage of the free and available manure of his animals. He can transform the manure into the two inputs he most needs for his business activity, energy and fertilizer. 

Enrique will be able to connect the biogas directly to the barbecue or cookstove in the house, and he will spread the nutrient-rich fertilizer on his corn field to increase its yield in a natural way. Not only will he save money, but he will also protect the environment by displacing fossil fuels, shifting to organic agriculture without chemical inputs, and treating the waste to avoid underground water source contamination and greenhouse gas emissions. 

As he saves money, Enrique plans to buy additional hogs and diversify his livestock by trying new races.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part will be covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en:
Nicasia operates a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells merchandise such as biscuits, chips, canned goods, toiletries and condiments.  She is a 51-year-old married woman with four children.  Her youngest child is 17. She has been operating a variety store for more than 10 years already.

Nicasia has requested a loan to buy canned goods and soft drinks. Adding stock to fill her store will cause more buyers to come and purchase.  This will help augment her daily earnings and enable her to handle her finances. She could set aside some savings for emergency purposes. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy more products and supplies needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 18,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies she needs to improve her business. She will also buy raw materials and supplies she needs to increase her production of doormats that she also sells. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Bebelyn wants her business to continue to flourish. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials she needs to increase her production of doormats which she also sells.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, su hermano le ayuda en el trabajo, inicio con capital propia desee hace varios años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con sus cultivos que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She makes a living in agriculture, sowing corn and beans. Her brother helps her with the work. She started it with her own capital various years ago. She sells her products in the areas surrounding where she lives and now she has many customers. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and improve the land shown in the photograph, and in that way be able to continue with her farming, which generates a good profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 51 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods and school supplies.

Emelia has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Emelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is 51 years old and married with one child.

Geneva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Geneva has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising goats.

Geneva aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 52 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Julia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Julia requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Julia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Julia would like to save money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 48 years old, married and has ten children, five of whom are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Delma requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Delma has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising goats. Lorna is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and a married woman with 4 children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Josephine has a general store business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sulfabladys

texts.es:
Sulfabladys, es dueña de una tienda de productos primera necesidad, la fundo hace 10 años, ha tomado clases para administrarla, una empleada le ayuda atender a sus clientes, cuenta con una ubicación favorable para atraer a nuevos clientes, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, de los cueles dos ya están casados y los otros viven con ella.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar estantes, golosinas, aceite, pan, galletas, papel higiénico, detergentes, etc. de esa manera volverá su negocio más competitivo y organizara mejor sus productos para que el negocio tenga una buena vistosidad.
Ella tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando para dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de graduarse de la universidad y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Sulfabladys is the owner of a general store, which she founded 10 years ago. She has taken classes to manage it; an employee helps her to attend to her customers.  She relies on a favorable location to attract new customers. She is a single mother of four children, of which two are already married and the others live with her. 

She will use the loan to buy shelves, snacks, oil, bread, cookies, toilet paper, detergents, etc. which will make her business more competitive and will better organize her products so that the business will look good.

She has the aspiration to continue working to give her children the opportunity to graduate from university and to pay off the debt acquired.

loans.use: to buy shelves, snacks, oil, bread, cookies, toilet paper, detergents, etc. which will make her business more competitive and will better organize her products

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un crédito que en esta ocasión utilizara para comprar dos cerdos y concentrado para los mismos, con esta nueva inversión podrá continuar fortaleciendo su negocio y teniendo a su alcance los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Al invertir el préstamo anterior en los trabajos de agricultura y la venta de ropa, sus ganancias han sido muy buenas, le han servido para dar a su familia una vida más digna y emprender la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
María is asking for a loan which, on this occasion, she will use to buy two pigs and feed for them. With this new investment, she will be able to continue strengthening her business and have in her reach the income that she needs to cover the household expenditures.

After investing the previous loan in the agriculture work and selling clothes, her earnings have been very good. They have allowed her to give her family a more dignified life and to undertake pig-rearing.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and feed for them, with this new investment she will be able to continue strengthening her business

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura, de 69 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, que depende de padres de bajos recursos económicos, no estudio debido a que en el lugar donde creció, no había escuelas, está casada y  tiene 5 hijos, los cuales ya tienen sus propias familias. 

Rosaura, se dedica al comercio de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, y empezó vendiendo entre sus vecinos, y como observo que le funciono, lo empezó a hacer en todo el lugar donde vive y ahora lo hace en los pueblos y caseríos de los alrededores de donde ella vive.- Su esposo cultiva maíz, frijol y maicillo.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para invertir $200 en la compra de ropa para el negocio, $200 para que su esposo compre abono y fertilizantes y los otros $600 para pagar 3 sacos de abono y herbicidas de la cosecha pasada.

Ella sueña con poder tener un negocio de ropa en el pueblo, donde los clientes puedan optar por más variedad de ropa y ella ya no tenga que caminar grandes distancias para ir a vender.
texts.en:
Rosaura, who is 69-years old, is a hard-working woman who came from a low-income family.  She didn't go to school because there wasn't one where she grew up.  Rosaura is married and has five children, who now have families of their own. 

Rosaura makes her living selling men's, women's and children's clothing.  She learned the business on her own initiative and started out selling to her neighbors.  She saw that it was going well and then began selling all around the area where she lives.  She now sells in the towns and villages around her area.  Rosaura's husband grows corn, beans and millet. 

Rosaura needs the money from the loan to invest $200 in purchasing clothing for her business, $200 so her husband can purchase compost and fertilizers and the other $600 to pay for three sacks of compost and herbicides from the last harvest. 

Rosaura dreams of having a clothing business in town, where customers could choose from a greater variety of clothing and she would no longer have to walk long distances to make her sales.

loans.use: to use $200 to buy clothing for her business, $200 to purchase compost and fertilizers and $600 to pay for the compost and herbicides from the last harvest.

loans.name: Na Group

texts.en:
Tor is excited that the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Tor and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water, were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Tor and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years. Tor and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Tor and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He is a 49-year-old married man. He was diagnosed with diabetes mellitus type 2 15 years ago and he did not treat it. For this reason, his retina is now seriously injured. Currently, his disease affects his work. If he does not undergo surgery, he will lose his sight and he needs to work because he supports his wife.

loans.use: to have eye surgery

loans.name: Thampha Group

texts.en: Khek’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khek and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Khek and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Khek’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang has lead the Mekar Sandat group for several loan cycles and now they are paying off all the loan together. During the six months they maintain the pigs, they can keep them well. Nutritious feed and vitamins are two things to which breeders give serious attention. It makes the pig grow as expected and they earn a satisfactory profit.
Ni Komang, beside being a breeder, she also works in the garden with her husband. She has two children, but only one child still in school. She will save all the profits to support her child's education. She has a dream to see her children graduate from university. To make it real, Ni Komang, together with other member of Mekar Sandat, decide to continue their loan. One member resigned from the group after she had enough savings to use as business capital. Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase superior piglets and feed. She hopes for the best and that her dream can come true for her children's futures.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Aminta Noemy

texts.es: Aminta de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene una tienda desde hace 5 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto para la cocina en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena ladrillos, hierro, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Aminta is 38-years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She has run a store for the last five years.  With the income from her sales, she is able to meet some of the household expenses.  Aminta wants to make improvements to her house by building a room for a kitchen in the space shown in the above photograph.  However, with what she earns from her sales, she doesn't have enough for the construction.  That is why she is requesting a loan, so she can purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, sheet metal and beams and to pay for labor.  Then she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, sheet metal and beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Almario

texts.en:
Almario is a married man who engages in fishing. He catches fish and sells them to the locals in the community. He is 39-year-old married man with four children. His oldest child is eight years old and the youngest is eight months old respectively. Almario has been engaged in fishing for five years already.   

He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets. These tools will be of great help to the family of Almario. His ongoing catches will improve and he will be able to augment his income. He could then afford to provide his family with nutritious diets and be able to finance the schooling of his children.

Almario dreams of expanding his fishing livelihood so that he could purchase a new machine for the motorboat which is very essential his day-to-day activity.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal Mainique de Urubamba.
La socia Feliciana tiene 54 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de de verduras en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracia sal empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras.
La socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Mainique de Urubamba" communal bank.
The member's name is Feliciana.  She is 54-years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily chores and her business selling vegetables in one of the markets in the area.  Feliciana has been making her living with this business for quite some time.  It has been going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business each day.  Feliciana hopes to keep working so she can continue supporting her family. 
She is requesting the loan to purchase vegetables. 
Feliciana is grateful for the loan she has been granted.  She promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for re-sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 5.000 through NWTF in order to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell to customers.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 45 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy noodles, shampoo, rice, sugar and other groceries.

Belinda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Belinda aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy noodles, shampoo, rice, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Marlon Jeovanny

texts.es:
Marlon, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento debido a que su negocio está creciendo y sus clientes merecen ser bien atendidos, comprara materiales de construcción para reparar los corrales en los que permanece el ganado y remodelar su vivienda, el resto será utilizado para adquirir insumos agrícolas para que sus cultivos tengan un buen desarrollo.
El crédito anterior ha tenido un impacto muy positivo, su ganado aumento y la cosecha de granos básicos ha sido abundante, su familia se mantiene y la situación económica es más estable.
texts.en:
Marlon is requesting a new loan because his business is growing and his customers deserve to receive good service. He will buy construction materials so that he can repair the pens where the cattle are kept and remodel his home. The rest of the money will be used to acquire farm supplies so that his crops can develop well.

His previous loan had a very positive impact. His cattle herd increased and his harvest of basic staple crops was abundant. His family remains the same and his financial situation is more stable.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his crops and construction materials in order to repair the cattle pens and remodel his house.

loans.name: José Israel

texts.es:
José, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, tuvo que abandonar la escuela por la situación económica de su familia, sus padres desde pequeño le enseñaron la agricultura y la ganadería, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, que le apoyan en las actividades agrícolas y en el cuido de los  animales.

José, trabaja durante la mañana en sus parcelas junto a sus hijos y en la tarde sus hijos trabajan en otras parcelas y él se dedica ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche en los alrededores.

José, ocupará el dinero del préstamo para comprar una novilla, con esta compra incrementará la producción de leche para la venta y obtendrá ingresos adicionales para su familia.

José, con los ingresos que obtenga de la venta de leche, de la siembra y del préstamo, podrá en un futuro comprar más animales y un terreno donde poderlos pastar.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and studied through the sixth grade. He had to abandon his schooling because of his family’s financial situation. His parents taught him farming and ranching at a young age. José is married and lives with his wife and their four children. They help him with the farming activities and the care of the animals.

In the morning, José and his children work on his parcels of land. In the afternoons, his children work on other parcels of land while he milks the cows. José sells the milk in the surrounding neighborhoods.

José will use the money from the loan to buy a heifer so that he can increase the production of milk for sale. This will help him generate additional income for his family. With the money he earns from selling milk, planting crops, and using this loan, he will be able to buy more animals in the future and a plot of land where they can graze.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Nonvilai Group

texts.en:
Daovieng’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells and streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Daovieng and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which Daovieng can now shift to other pursuits. Daovieng and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within this 2 years, filter users, like Daovieng’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nhóm 4- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Hanh is a 36-year-old woman, who works in agricultural production, with a monthly income of nearly 700,000 VND. She is married and has two young children. 

Hanh has been a member of the Women's Union since 1999. Currently, she has nerve pain that makes it difficult for her to work. Due to economic hardship, her family has not yet been able to build a septic tank latrine, and is currently using a double-pit latrine which is degraded. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to gain access to latrine hardware facilities which include a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and personal safety, and contribute to the environmental health of the community. In the picture, Hanh is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet, and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, además cultiva café con ayuda de algunos de sus familiares, inicio con capital propio y ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad, comercializa sus productos en los meses de diciembre a febrero en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos, control de plagas, herbicidas entre otras cosas y así poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, works growing corn and beans, as well as growing coffee with the help of some relatives.  He started out with his own capital, and he now has worked in this business for several years.  He sells his products in the months of December to February in the bulk grains sales and purchasing agencies.  The young man lives in his own house with his family group.  He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, compost, pest control, and weed killer, among other things, and thereby be able to continue on with his work, which generates good income for him.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, compost, pest control, and weed killer, among other things.

loans.name: Celso Antonio

texts.es: Celso de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, l se dedica al cultivo de loroco, maíz, maicillo y también a la crianza de ganado, tiene prácticamente toda su vida productiva de dedicarse a las labores agrícolas, sus productos los vende en os alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así seguir con sus siembras para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Celso is 43 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and their four children. He grows “loroco” [a vine that produces edible flowers], corn, and sorghum. Celso also raises cattle. He has spent practically his entire life working on a farm. His products are sold in the surrounding neighborhoods near where he lives. With the income he generates from his sales, Celso is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can improve the land shown in the photograph. As a result, he can continue planting crops so that he can have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can improve his land.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, powdered milk, eggs, soap and seasonings. She has five grown children. It has been four years now that she has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store.

She is asking for a loan to purchase grocery items and soft drinks. Her store will be full of stock again and attract more buyers to purchase. These will help to improve her sales and augment her income.

She hopes that someday her sari-sari (variety) store will expand and her livelihood will be sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to buy more groceries and supplies needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 13,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries and beverages she needs to improve her business. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business to becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Ma. Linda wants to improve their present financial condition and she hopes to grow her business as well as start up other business opportunities. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.*

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn earns a living by engaging as a dealer in personal collection products. She sells powdered soap, fabric conditioner, toilet bowl cleaner and body spray. She is a mother of a two-year-old daughter. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of soap. This will help her sell more soap to her respective customers. With this, her income will augment and start to balance her finances. She can then provide her child with a nutritious diet and better shelter in which to live.

She hopes that her business will be productive and sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soap

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 44 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school; she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Russel has a general store business in the Philippines. Russel requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, shampoos, soft drinks and other items.

Russel has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Russel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, shampoos, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 58 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Barbara has a general store business in the Philippines. Barbara requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like rice, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

Barbara has been in this business for five years. In the future, Barbara would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, necesita de invertir en su negocio, por lo que requiere de un crédito para comprar concentrado, afrecho y zacate para alimentar mejor al ganado.
Con el crédito anterior la ganadería se mantienen mejorando y sus nuevos ingresos son utilizados para cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos needs to invest in her business, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy concentrated feed, bran, and hay in order to feed her cattle a better diet.

As a result of her previous loan, her cattle kept improving and her new profits were used to repay her debts and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, bran, and hay for her cattle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer veterana de 41 años de edad, una mujer muy humilde, con necesidades, ella se separó de su esposo y quedo como madre cabeza de familia de 2 hijas  de  20 y 7 años de edad, la supervivencia, el generar recursos le ha sido difícil para esta mujer quien ha sido ama de casa prácticamente toda su vida.

María en su juventud aprendió empíricamente a realizar manillas y es esta la actividad que por el momento la ha mantenido a ella y a sus hijas.

María solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para realizar sus artículos, espera tener éxito en ventas y sacar sus hijas de la pobreza, mejorar sus condiciones de vida que estudie y luchen por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María is an experienced woman who is 41 years of age. She is a humble woman with needs. María separated from her husband and was left as the head of her family, which includes her two daughters, ages 20 and 7. In order to survive, she must generate an income, but this is difficult for a woman who has been a housewife practically her entire life.

In her youth, María learned how to make wristbands on her own. At the moment, this business is the means by which she is able to support herself and her daughters. María is requesting a loan in order to buy the materials for making these items. She hopes to be successful with her sales so that she can lift her daughters out of poverty, improve their living conditions, provide for their studies, and strive to give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials for making handcrafted wristbands.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE PICHINGOTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maras, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juana Rosa se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra zanahorias y papas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE PICHINGOTO”. The bank is located in the Maras district, which is in the Urubamba province, and the department of Cusco.

The member, Juana Rosa makes a living in farming. Juana Rosa has a cropland where she sows carrots and potatoes. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She already has several years in this business, and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her agriculture business. She requests a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

She is happy for the loan, and undertakes to comply with the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Olivia ella es casada tiene 34 años y tiene 3 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte en mototaxi, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el manteniendo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Asis de Urubamba”. This bank is located in the District of Urubamba in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Olivia. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Olivia divides her time between her daily activities and managing a business in which she provides motorcycle taxi services. She has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Olivia wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family. She is requesting a loan in order to pay for maintenance.

Olivia is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de granos básicos, inicio con capital propio, desde hace varios años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. Y asi seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He works in agriculture by planting basic staple crops. He started out several years ago with his own capital. When his harvest is ready, he stores his crops in granaries (like the one shown in the photo) and then sells them in the surrounding neighborhoods near where he lives. The borrower lives in his own home along with his life companion.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies. As a result, he can continue his work so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es: Reyna de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde y a la venta de tamales, cuenta con más de 6 años de experiencia en su negocio, comercializa sus pollos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos de engorde y concentrado para poder seguir con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 33 years old and lives in her own home along with her life companion and her daughter. She raises chickens for fattening and also sells tamales. Reyna has more than six years of business experience. She sells the chickens at different markets that are located near her home. With the income she generates from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Reyna is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens for fattening and concentrated feed so that she can continue her work. As a result, she will have more income.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, de 38 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, ya que sus padres pensaban que eso era una perdida de tiempo, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales trabajan con ella y también asisten a la escuela, en su casa solo viven sus hijos y su compañero de vida. 

Ana, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de leche desde hace 18 años, prácticamente vende leche desde que se acompaño con su esposo, porque tiene vacas de ordeño.- También, siembra maíz, la parcela está ubicada a 3 kilómetros de su casa, sus hijos también ayudan con las vacas y los cultivos; ella se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a ayudarle a su esposo a ordeñar y luego prepara la leche en un recipiente para venderla.

Ana, a pensado poner una pequeña venta de frutas en su casa, es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo para comprar frutas como papayas, sandia, melones, naranjas y manzanas, etc. 

El sueño de Ana, es poder darles a sus hijos la oportunidad que estudien, para que tangan mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and did not have the opportunity to attend school because her parents thought it was a waste of time. She is in a relationship and has four children who attend school and also work with her. The only ones living at home with her are her children and her life companion.

Ana has a small business in which she has been selling milk for the past 18 years. She has been selling milk practically since the time she met her husband because he owns dairy cows. Ana also grows corn on a parcel of land that is located three kilometers from her house. Her children also look after the cows and the crops. Ana wakes up at 4:00 A.M. so that she can help her husband with milking the cows. Later in the day, she prepares the milk by putting it in containers so that it can be sold.

Ana plans to set up a small fruit business at her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fruits such as papayas, watermelons, melons, oranges, apples, and other produce. Her dream is to give her children the opportunity to study so that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy papayas, watermelons, melons, oranges, apples, and other fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, pesticides and labor costs to assist their coffee crops.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sol Naciente” está conformado por 08 socios responsables. Maritza de 31 años es casada y  tiene 03 hijos dependientes. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes hace un año que puso dicho negocio, donde le va bien. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación puede brindarles  educación a sus hijos. El deseo de Maritza es de seguir implementando su negocio y poner una bodega más grande para tener más clientes. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, menestras. El grupo “Sol Naciente” agradece  por hacer posible este crédito. Maritza se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado derecho viste chompa blanca.
texts.en:
The group, “Sol Naciente”, is made up of 8 responsible members. 

Maritza, 31, is married and has 3 dependent children. She has a small store, in her house, where she sells groceries. She started her business a year ago, and it's going well. Thanks to her strength and dedication, she can provide an education for her children. 

Maritza's dream is to continue working at her business, and to add a bigger warehouse, so that she can have more customers. It is for that, that she requests the loan to buy rice, sugar, and dried vegetables. The group, “Sol Naciente”, appreciates that this loan is made possible. Maritza is in the back, and is the second from the right side, wearing a white sweater.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and dried vegetables.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto y colocando piso cerámico, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro, cerámica y pago de mano de obra y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Dora is 51 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She has been working as a seamstress for the past 10 years. With the income she earns from her work, Dora is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She wants to improve her home by building a room and installing a ceramic floor, but she does not earn enough from her work to pay for this project. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron, ceramic tiles, as well as pay for labor. As a result, Dora and her family can live more comfortably and in a clean environment.

loans.use: to pay for cement, bricks, sand, iron, ceramic tiles, and labor.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE PICHINGOTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maras, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ruth se dedica al negocio de venta de sal, la socia trabaja en una empresa donde venden sal, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio propio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Natividad de Pichingoto”. This bank is located in the District of Maras in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Ruth manages a business where she sells salt. Through this business she is able to get ahead. Her dream has been to have a business of her own. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house.

Ruth is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of tissue and fabrics, which she can resell to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 48 ans, Akouavi est une femme avec deux enfants à sa charge. Akouavi habite à Attiégou et dispose d’un four pour faire du pain fabriqué à base de la farine, du sucre et divers ingrédients. Akouavi livre les pains à plusieurs clients dans le quartier et gagne son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour arriver à ses fins, Akouavi s’approvisionne trois fois par semaine. Pour commander des sacs de farine et du sucre,  Akouavi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider ses enfant dans leurs éducations
texts.en: Akouavi is 48 years old and single.  She has two children in her care.  She lives in Attiégou and she has an oven in which she makes bread from flour, sugar and various other ingredients.  She delivers her breads to several clients in the neighborhood, and it is thanks to this activity that she makes an income.  In order to do this, Akouavi buys supplies three times per week.  She will use this loan to order bags of flour and sugar.  This loan will allow her to make this purchase and to have a source of income which will help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy three bags of flour and one bag of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lengths of fabric for dressmaking.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

NWTF is relisting Lolita's business profile to help support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Soroyiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
La dame qui a ses deux mains sur le sac de riz sur la photo est BINTOU M.
BINTOU M est une  Malienne non scolarisée, âgée  de 62  ans, mère  de  08 enfants qui sont tous âgés plus de 20 ans et  tous mariés. Son mari fait la  pêche pour subvenir a ses besoins. BINTOU M fait le stockage du riz et de l’arachide, depuis plus de 30  ans. Elle fait  recourt au RMCR  pour pouvoir satisfaire ces  petits  besoins et ceux de ses petits-fils avec le profit qu’elle gagne. Elle achète son  stock  dans le marché de sa  localité et  revend dans le même  marché. Elle  compte avoir un prêt plus élevé  dans les jours à venir pour développer ces activités de stockages.
texts.en:
The lady with both hands on the bag of rice in the photo is Bintou M.
Bintou M is from Mali and did not attend school; she is 62 years old and is the mother of eight children; all are over 20 and married. Her husband is a fisherman in order to meet their living expenses.
Bintou M stores rice and peanuts, and has done so for over 30 years. She seeks help from RMCR in order to cover some of the smaller expenses, as well as those of her grandchildren with the profit she generates.
She buys her stock locally, and resells in the same market. She hopes to obtain a larger loan in the future, in order to grow her storage business.

loans.use: to buy bags of cereals for resale at a later date.

loans.name: Birenam

texts.fr: A 31 ans, Birenam est une femme veuve et avec ses quatre enfants, elle vit dans le quartier de Nukafu. Restauratrice, Birenam vend du riz et du haricot préparé dans son quartier. Birenam s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local. Birenam réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Birenam nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des bols de haricot et du gari safin de  gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en: Birenam is 31 years old and a widow with four children in her care.  She lives in the Nukafu neighborhood.  She is involved in the preparation of dishes and sells rice and beans in her neighborhood.  She buys supplies twice a week at a local market.  Birenam's small business is quite profitable.  She needs this loan to buy bowlfuls of beans as well as cassava flour in order to increase her profits and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 34 bowlfuls of beans and 17 bowlfuls of cassava flour.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: A 36 ans, Amah est une femme veuve et avec ses trois enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Attiégou. Amah est une marchande de chaussures qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Amah s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local. Amah réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Amah nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
36 years old, Amah is a widow and she lives with her three children in the d’Attiégou district. Amah is a mobile shoe-seller and she works on foot in the neighbouring streets in order to get her sales.
She buys her stock twice a month in a local market, and achieves very good profitability with her business. Amah needs this loan in order to buy shoes so she can earn a profit to help finance her childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy 8 dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of nine grown children from Leyte, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years. This is the only source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Abundia would like to avail a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. This loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. 
 
Abundia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh vit à Sokpanou et est âgée de 21 ans. Mariée, Edoh est mère d’un seul enfant et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son éducation. Edoh vend des nattes dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Edoh s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des tas de nattes, Edoh demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité
texts.en:
Edoh lives in Sokpanou and is 21 years old. Married, Edoh is the mother of one child and she works hard in order to support his education. Edoh sells mats in her neighbourhood and the surrounding area, in order to have the income they need to survive.
Edoh buys her supplies twice a month in the market. In order to order packs of braids, Edoh is requesting this loan to make the purchase and to grow her profitability.

loans.use: to purchase four packs of braids and some wire.

loans.name: Nhóm 12- An Thanh V2 Group

texts.en:
Tham, pictured first from the left, is a 46-year-old farmer who makes a monthly income of about VND 400,000. 

She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1989. She is married with 2 children who are attending university. Her husband has been sick for a whole year and their family is classified as a poor family. They can not afford to have a sanitary latrine. 

With this loan, Tham will use the funds to build a toilet which will improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. It will also contribute to the environmental health of the community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 47 years old, married and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit à Kohé et est âgée de 52 ans. Mariée, Akossiwa est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Akossiwa vend des perles dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Akossiwa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paquets de perles Akossiwa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 52 years old, married and lives in Kohé.  She has four children and works hard to provide for their education.  She sells bead necklaces in her district and surrounding area to earn enough to maintain her family.

Once a month, Akossiwa buys new supplies from the market.  She has requested this loan in order to buy more necklaces and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 10 packets of bead necklaces for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beef cattle for fattening up and selling on.

loans.name: Phonxai Group

texts.en:
Thavone is excited the water filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Thavone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  

Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Thavone and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years.  

Thavone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases.  After totaling up the costs, Thavone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase water filters so that they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
