loans.use: To purchase a solar solution for her business which will help to increase her income

loans.name: Nhóm 13- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Tan, 37, works in the agricultural sector and earns about VND 400,000 monthly. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1988. Her husband died so she has to raise 3 little children alone.  

Due to the family's economic hardships, her household does not have a sanitary latrine yet. A portion of Group 13 - An Thanhv2's loan will help Tan, as well as other group members, to build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap, which will improve the living conditions of the family members and contribute to the sanitary improvement of the community. 

In this picture, Tan is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Paterno

texts.en:
Paterno is a 51-year-old married man living in Leyte, Philippines. He earns a living through his poultry business. Paterno has raised chickens for more than five years now. Paterno also earns an additional income through a sari-sari, or retail store, business. 

Paterno is asking for a loan to buy more chickens to raise and to buy more stock for his store such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. 

Paterno believes that a loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Paterno hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to raise and to buy more stock for his store.

loans.name: Nhóm 14- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Chuyen is 50 years old and works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 450,000 VND. Chuyen and her husband are living in a house with their 3 school-age children. 

She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1984. Chuyen is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community, and environmental contamination. 

However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. 

These facilities will help her family improve their health and living conditions, while also affording safety for them (particularly at night and during rainstorms). In addition this will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community. 

In the picture, Chuyen is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Jèkafo Group

texts.fr:
Lassana est l'homme qui tient le mouton en main sur la photo.
Lassina est un jeune maliens de 38 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants âgée de 13 à 2 ans, trois de ses enfants fréquentent l’école, sa conjointe est ménagère, il vit dans un petit village de cultivateur au Mali.
Lassina est analphabète, mais connait l’utilité de l’école,  inscrit tous ses enfant ayant l’âgé d’aller à l’école. Il fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter plus d’animaux à emboucher et à élever , il les revend après pour préparer  un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants. En plus de l’agriculture Lassina fait l’embouche et l’élevage des petits ruminants. Il s’approvisionne dans les foires hebdomadaires  de la place et y revend ses produits. Il génère un intérêt de 60.000fcfa durant le cycle de l’embouche ; ses bénéfices l’aident à : habiller, soigner, scolariser et nourrir sa famille.
Malgré l’absence d’école dans le village Lassina encourage ses enfants à ne pas abandonner l’école. Il rêve de trouver  trois vélos pour les enfants qui faciliteront leur déplacement de tous les jours. Les enfants de Lassina marchent une dizaine de kilomètre par jours pour rejoindre l’école.
texts.en:
Lassana is the man holding the sheep in the photo.  He is 38 years old, Malian, married and father to four children.  His children are aged between two and thirteen years, three of them attend school.  His wife is a housewife and they live in a small, agricultural village in Mali.  Lassina cannot read or write but he understands the importance of schooling and has registered all of his school-age children to attend.

Lassana works with the field partner, RMCR, in order to be able to buy more animals for fattening up.  He sells them on to ensure a better future for his children.  Lassana works in agriculture as well as raising ruminants.  He buys his animals at the local weekly fair and sells them at the same fair.

Over the fattening up cycle, Lassana makes 60,000 francs CFA.  His profit allows him to feed, clothe, educate and provide healthcare for his family.

Despite the absence of a school in his village, Lassana encourages his children to continue with their studies.  He dreams of being able to buy three bicycles to help his children get to school.  At the moment, they walk around ten kilometres a day to get to school.

loans.use: to buy animals for selling on.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy more supplies to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve further her business if you will lend her an amount of 21,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buying additional supplies and direct selling products for her to sell. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will lead her business to becoming more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Lilia wants for her children to finish their studies and to have a better future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for direct selling products and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Melliendres

texts.en:
Melliendres is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Melliendres has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Melliendres's business profile to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Trabajar por tu familia, trabajar por los demás, trabajar por progresar fueron las enseñanzas que dejo en Luis Antonio su padre quien hace unos años inicio un negocio de cultivos el cual posteriormente le heredo, dejándole cultivos y unas valiosas enseñanzas las cuales le sirvieron a este hombre de 68 años en toda su vida y que busca trasmitirla en sus hijos.

Luis Antonio es padre de 8 hijos es increíble ver trabajar a este hombre incluso a su edad solo por llevar el sustento a su casa, lo más increíble es que Luis Antonio no puede ejercer el trabajo por una incapacidad pero su increíble fuerza de voluntad lo hace levantar todos los días a ejercer su profesión.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, comprara fungicidas y gallinaza el resto de capital lo invertirá en abonos.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio’s father taught him that he should work for his family, for others, and in order to progress. Some years ago, Luis’s father started a business growing crops, and Luis later inherited this business. He was left crops and valuable teachings that helped this 68-year-old with his life. He now wants to leave the business to his own children.

Luis is a father to eight children and it is incredible to see this man work at his age, and to see him support his household. Most incredible is that Luis has a disability that means he should not be able to do this work but, with a strong will, he gets up early every day to work in the fields.

Luis is applying for this loan in order to buy farming supplies, including fungicides and hen droppings, and other manures.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, including fungicides and hen droppings, and other manures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Thongnamee Group

texts.en:
Kone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Kone and her group are excited that this water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.  

Kone and her group also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within the 2 years, filter users like Kone’s family can expect to see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thongnoy Group

texts.en:
Taen understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Taen knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Taen purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Taen is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so that she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Namko Group

texts.en:
Viengphone understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Viengphone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Viengphone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  

Viengphone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years so that she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep for later resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Doélé

texts.fr: Doélé vit à Apédokoè et est âgée de 34 ans. Mariée, Doélé est mère de deux enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Doélé vend des boissons dans son quartier pour avoir un revenu leur permettant de faire face aux charges quotidiennes. Doélé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paquets des boissons, Doélé demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Doélé is 34 years old and lives in Apédokoè.  She is married and mother to two children.  She works very hard to provide for their education.  Doélé sells drinks in her neighbourhood to generate money for the day-to-day expenses of her family.

Doélé buys new supplies once a month from the market.  She has requested this loan to buy packets of drinks to retail and make a profit.

loans.use: to buy 28 packets of drinks for resale.

loans.name: Davigan

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 22 ans, Davigan est une femme qui habite à Gbomamé. Davigan vend des produits de beauté et des mèches dans le quartier et gagne son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour arriver à ses fins, Davigan s’approvisionne trois fois par mois. Pour commander des pommades et des mèches,  Davigan demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin de subvenir favorablement à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Davigan is 22 years old and single.  She lives in Gbomamé and sells beauty products and hair extensions in her district.  This is how she earns a living.

Three times a month, Davigan buys further supplies.  She has requested this loan so she can buy pommades and hair extensions.  The profit generated will provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen pommades and 3 dozen hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 31 ans, Afi est une femme au foyer et habite à Adidogomé. Afi vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide à son mari. Afi s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché local du quartier. Pour commander quelque sac de riz et de l’huile, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et augmenter sa marge de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Afi is 31 years old, married and lives in Adidogomé.  She is a housewife but also sells general food products to help her husband support their household.

She buys her supplies once a week from the local market.  Afi has requested this loan to buy sacks of rice and oil, and generate a profit.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice and 1 drum of oil for resale.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad, se dedicas a prestar servicios de manicura y pedicura tanto en su hogar como a domicilio.
Natalia vive junto con su pareja y es madre de 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad y aunque fue madre teniendo tan solo 16 años de edad, no se arrepiente y agradece la bendición que recibió.

Su idea con su negocio fue tener una entrada extra de dinero para colaborarle a su pareja, pero como ha ido creciendo, tiene más clientes, es más buscada ahora proyecta todos su esfuerzo para montar un centro de belleza especializado en manicura y pedicura.

Natalia Solicita un préstamo para realizar unas reformas locativas que serían cambio de herramientas, dejar de usar una ponchera y pasar a tener una silla de manicura y pedicura, comprar implementos como barnice, limas , entre otras variedades de productos.
texts.en:
Natalia is a 22 year old entrepreneur. She offers services such as manicures and pedicures in her home and in her customers' home. Natalia lives with her spouse and she is the mother of 2 children, aged 6 and 4. Although she became a mother when she was only 16, she does not regret it and she is grateful for the blessing she received.  

Her idea for the business was to have an extra source of income to help her spouse. However, it has grown and she has more customers. She is more sought after now and she is putting all of her effort into opening a salon specializing in manicures and pedicures. 

Natalia is asking for a loan to make reforms on her locale, such as changing her tools, not using a tub anymore and having a manicure and pedicure chair, and buy implements such as polish, files, and other types of products.

loans.use: to change tools, to get a manicure and pedicure chair, and to buy implements such as polish, files, and more.

loans.name: Marledis Ester

texts.es:
Marledis es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente 1 año inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Marledis busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos y comprar propiamente pollos de engorde. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Marledis tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. 

Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Marledis¡
texts.en:
Marledis is a person who has had to go through a lot of adversities in life. Nonetheless, she has always had the strength to overcome them and get ahead with her children.  

Approximately a year ago, she started to look desperately for a source of income for her home. That was how she started raising and selling chickens. This business has generated her income with which she is able to pay for the household expenses. 

Marledis is seeking a loan to have the possibility of purchasing things to care for the chickens, to fix up the chicken pen, and buy broiler chickens. She knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar she can do it.  

Marledis hopes that with the loan she will be able to get ahead with her business. In addition, she hopes that her business will grow and generate more income to offer her children a better quality of life and more opportunities to progress.  

With a loan that you give her today you will be able to improve the life and business of Marledis!

loans.use: to purchase things to care for chickens, to fix up the chicken pen and to buy broiler chickens.

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
DUFATANYE is a group led by Pascasie, who is 32 years old. The group name means “work together” in English. 

She has been a group leader for four years. She has a shop and has been doing business for the past four years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children, and she plans to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Aidita Lucia

texts.es:
Aidita tiene 42 años de edad es soltera tiene 3 hijos vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Rios.

Ella tiene un salón de Belleza y solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para mejorar la imagen del salón para asi que lleguen mas clientes y poder mejoarar su economia ya que es madre soltera ynecesita para poder mantener a sus hijos, las compra realizara en Ventanas, su sueño es comprarse un carro y el desafio al que se enfrenta es las enfermedades, en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aidita is 42 years old. She is single and has 3 children. She lives in Ventanas, province of Los Rios.

She has a beauty salon and she is asking for the loan to buy materials to improve the salon's image. This way, more customers will arrive and she can improve her finances. She is a single mother and she needs to be able to support her children. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. Her dream is to buy a car and the challenge she faces are illnesses. In her free time, she likes to spend her time with her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en: Iris is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of two children aged 14 and 10. She earns a living through a hog-raising business. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Iris is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income. In the future, Iris hopes to make her business a success so that it will generate more revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Nhóm 15- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Huong, 46 years old, works in agriculture production where she earns a monthly income of about 700,000 VND (about $33). She is married and has two children still in school. Currently, their family uses an unsafe, unhygienic latrine. However, her local women's union, where she has been a member since 1989, has recently started a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene. A portion of Group 15 - An ThanhV2's loan will help Huong as well as other group members build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. In the photo, Huong stands on the first to the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Mimve

texts.en:
Mimve is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mimve successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Mimve's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Nida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Nida's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Keo Group

texts.en: Suda is excited that the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Suda and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Suda and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Suda and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Suda and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonkham Group

texts.en: Khampheng’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khampheng and his group are excited that a water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Khampheng and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 year period, filter users, like Khampheng’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Viengxai Group

texts.en: Phaengdee understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Phaengdee knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phaengdee purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Phaengdee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so her family can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Nakhamphaeng Group

texts.en: Beer is excited that a water filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Beer and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Beer and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Beer and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Beer and her group recognized the substantial financial savings that a water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anastacio Manuel

texts.es:
Anastasio es un hombre residente de Lorica, una zona donde la inclusión y la ayuda social es algo limitada, debido a los problemas de orden público de está, es una zona humilde, pero con personas que sonríen, personas llenas de ganas de trabajar como el mismo Anastasio que aunque no pudo encontrar un empleo no se detuvo en sus intenciones por ser productivo, sentirse útil y llevar el alimento para su familia. 

Anastasio es padre de 6 hijos 3 hombres de 10, 17, 12 años de edad y tres mujeres de 23, 16,  11 años de edad, ellos son todo para él se esfuerza al límite trabajando largas jornadas solo para que ellos coman bien y tenga un estudio y vivienda digna.

Anastasio se desempeña como VENDEDOR de carne de cerdo y aunque es una actividad humilde pero gracias a ellos su familia se encuentra bien.

Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la totalidad en carne de cerdo.
texts.en:
Anastasio is a man, resident of Lorica, a zone where inclusion and social help is somewhat limited, due to the problems of public order. It is a humble zone, but with people who smile, people full of desire to work such as Anastasio who, although he couldn't find a job, wasn't deterred in his intentions to be productive, feel useful, and bring food to his family.  

Anastasio is the father of 6 children, 3 men ages 10, 17 and 12, and three women ages 23, 16, and 11. They are everything for him, and he works to the limit working long days just so that they can eat well, have an education and a respectable life. 

Anastasio works as a pork seller and although it is a humble job, thanks to it, his family is well.

He asks for a loan that he will invest in its totality in pork.

loans.use: to purchase pork for his business.

loans.name: Otoniel Jose

texts.es:
Otoniel es un hombre de 60 años de edad, es todo un luchador de la vida, siempre le gusto el trabajo independiente y así logro mantener y criar a su familia que la conforman su pareja y 6 hijos ya ellos mayores de edad.

Con su negocio de venta de carne de res la cual valga la oferta tanto en su hogar como amigos, vecinos, una actividad la cual ha logrado hacer muy personalizada y muy práctica ya que lleva el pedido hasta el hogar y prepara el corte al gusto de la persona.

Con su negocio Otoniel lo que quiere lograr es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pues aunque le ha dado para generar el alimento no pasa de algo más de eso y es algo que lo tiene algo decaído debido a la impotencia por poder generar más y no hacerlo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una res la cual sacrificara y prepara la carne la cual venderá buscando ese algo más en ventas  que le hace falta.
texts.en:
Otoniel is a 60-year-old man, is a fighter for life. He always liked to work independently and in this way managed to support and raise his family that is made up of his partner and 6 children who are now adults.

His business is selling beef, which is worthy of offering in his home as well as to his friends and neighbors, work that he has managed to do very personally and practically since he brings the order to the home and prepares the cut to the person's liking.

With his business, what Otoniel wants to achieve is to be able to improve the condition of his house since although he has enough to provide food, he doesn't have more than that and it is something that has him somewhat downcast due to his inability to earn more and not to be able to.

He asks for a loan to purchase a cow which he will butcher and prepare the meat which he will sell, looking in this way to make some more sales, which he needs.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to sell its meat.

loans.name: Phousan Group

texts.en: Laha understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Laha knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Laha purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Laha is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nhóm 16- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nham, 61 years old, works in agriculture production where she earns a monthly income of about 600,000 VND (about $29). She is married and has 2 grown children who live separately from her. Currently, due to a shortage of funds, their family still uses an unsafe, unhygienic latrine. However, her local women's union, where she has been a member since 1974, has recently started a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene. A portion of Group 16 - An ThanhV2's loan will help Nham as well as other group members build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. In the photo, Nham is pictured fifth from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Jeanne est une femme mariée qui vit avec deux enfants à Adidogomé. Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Jeanne vend des pagnes et réalise des habits qu’elle expose dans son atelier. Jeanne réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Jeanne demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille
texts.en:
Jeanne, age 33, is married and lives with two children in Adidogomé. To help them blossom, she sells "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and makes clothes that she displays in her workshop.

Thanks to this business, she makes a profit. She gets supplies twice a month at the market.

To facilitate her orders, Jeanne is seeking this loan to buy pieces of pagnes and achieve a profit margin that will help her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy seven pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Gnouanthong Group

texts.en: Vonexai’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Vonexai and her group are excited that a water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Vonexai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years, filter users, like Vonexai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a 46-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her food-vending business. She sells barbecue and snack foods like biscuits and chips. Elisa has been in the business for more than four years now. Elisa is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, biscuits and chips. A loan will help improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, biscuits and chips

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
She is Liberty and she is grateful for the loan granted to her, for she was able to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her computer units. The loan is also useful for her family's daily needs. Her income from the loan assisted with everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed to increase her profits from her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Liberty hopes that her business will continue to become successful and she dreams of financial freedom for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeniva

texts.en:
Jeniva is 37-year-old hard-working mother from Talibon, Bohol. She buys coconuts and sells copra (dried coconut kernel). Copra can be made either by smoke-drying or sun-drying.  She has 3 children, ages 15, 10 and 2.  Her husband is a driver/mechanic and his income will help defray the cost of the family's daily needs.

She has requested a loan to buy more coconuts in order to produce copra, which she will be able to sell to her respective buyers. With this, she can provide her family with a nutritious diet and provide her children with better shelter.
 
She is hoping that her present source of income will be successful for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is a sari-sari or retail store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is 52 years old and has been in the business for more than five years now. Marcelina earns an additional income through a barbecue business. Marcelina is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, condiments, cooking oil, biscuits, snack foods, soap, detergents and other items. A loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers to her store. Marcelina dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, condiments, cooking oil, biscuits, snack foods, soap, detergents and other items

loans.name: Jailaxmi Group

texts.en:
Jai Laxmi group was formed in 2015 by nine active and self-dependent women of M.Rampur, village with an objective of developing their existing businesses. All the members of this group have their own businesses. Sangita is one of them. 

The lady standing in the middle of the first row is Sangita. She is 22 years old and living with her husband and one child. 

Sangita has been engaged in a hotel (restaurant) business from her own home of M.Rampur village for four years. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 INR. Sangita says that although she is earning an outstanding income, it is not sufficient to maintain the family, invest in the business and realize her dreams. 

Sangita plans to get more income by expanding her business with the present loan amount. She plans to purchase 10 chairs, five tables and other accessories for her hotel. She hopes to save money to provide better education to her children.

The other members of her group are also doing small enterprises like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, general store and transport business, and with this loan, they hope to enhance their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the restaurant.

loans.name: Triranga Group

texts.en:
The group named Triranga was formed in 2015 by 12 active and self-dependent women of Musiguda village with an objective of developing their existing businesses. All the members of this group have their own business. Rinabala is one of them. 

The lady standing in the second row, third person from the right with hand raised is Rinabala. She is 28 years old and living with her husband and one child. 

Rinabala has been engaged in a grocery shop business from her own home of Musiguda village for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 8,900 INR. Rinabala says that although she is earning an wonderful income, it is not sufficient to maintain the family, invest in the business and realize her dreams. 

To get more income, Rinabala plans to improve her business with the present loan amount. She will purchase a huge quantity of grocery items. She hopes to save money for construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other 11 members of her group are also doing small enterprises like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, general store and transport business, and with this loan, they hope to enhance their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea, dry milk, oil, washing powder, wheat, rice, potato, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Taladhwaja Group

texts.en:
This group, named Taladhwaja, was formed in 2015 by 12 active and self-dependent women of Naktiguda village with the objective of developing their existing businesses. All the members of this group do their own industry. Tapaswini is one of them. 

The lady standing in the second row, fourth person from the right side with raised hand is Tapaswini. She is 31 years old and living with her husband and one child. 

Tapaswini has been engaged in a tailoring business from her own home in Naktiguda village for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 8,700 INR. Tapaswini says that although she is earning an outstanding income, it is not sufficient to maintain the family, invest in the business and realize her dreams. So Tapaswini has planned to get more income by expanding her business with the present loan amount. She plans to purchase a tailoring machine and other accessories for her tailoring business post disbursement. She hopes to save money to provide better education to her children.

The other members of her group are also doing small enterprises like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, general store and transport business, and with this loan, hope to enhance their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase an advanced sewing machine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a fish vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has two children, age 6 and 4. 

Jennifer is has been in the fish-selling business for more than five years now. Jennifer is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. 

Jennifer dreams of expanding her fishing venture in the future in order to generate more revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to take a loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is business woman from Leyte, Philippines. 

She runs a small motorcycle repair shop with her husband. Evangeline has been in the business for more than five years now. 

Evangeline is asking to take a loan to buy more materials like nuts and bolts, chains, screwdrivers, fuel and wires. A loan will help Evangeline and her husband improve their business, thus allowing them  to cater to more customers in their shop.  

In the future, Evangeline hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more materials like nuts and bolts, chains, screwdrivers, fuel and wires.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Roberta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Roberta is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Roberta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Roselda

texts.en:
Roselda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Roselda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Roselda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the previous loan, she managed to buy iron sheets to roof her house. 

She has a produce store selling beans, ground nuts and maize flour where she works 7 days a week, 5 hours per day. She is faced with the hardship of limited capital which hinders the progress of her business. However, she still hopes to complete her house. 

Gladys has asked for another loan to buy timber for her house construction.

loans.use: to buy timber to construct her house.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans. Mère d’un enfant,  Ayélé vit à Gbomamé pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Ayélé vend des friperies dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Ayélé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Ayélé sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des jupes et des tricots qu’elle pourra vendre et faire une bonne rentabilité.
texts.en:
Ayélé is 36 years old and married with one child. She lives in Gbomamé, where she runs her business.

To provide for her family, Ayélé earns money by working as a travelling saleswoman, selling second-hand clothing in the neighbourhood.

Ayélé buys her goods at the market twice a month. In the interest of rebuilding her stock, Ayélé is requesting this loan so she can buy skirts and knitwear to resell at a good profit.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen skirts and ten dozen items of knitwear.

loans.name: Nhóm 17- An Thanhv2 Group

texts.en:
Lua, pictured first from the left, is a 44-year-old farmer who makes about VND 700,000 monthly. She is married and has two children who are attending university. She has been member of the local Women's Union since 1990. 

Lua is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members and her community and of causing environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. 

A portion of Group Nhóm 17-An ThanhV2's loan will help Lua, as well as other group members, build a hygienic toilet in her home. This will improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Medina Plateau Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois de Medina Plateau a été inauguré le 19 février 2001. Ce groupe rembourse toujours ses  prêts à temps. Il est constitué de femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce de produits halieutiques. Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée âgée de 52 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de de produits halieutiques depuis plus de 10 ans. Le crédit sollicité va lui permettre d'acheter des poissons qu'elle va revendre au marché. Elle a une bonne maitrise de son activité. Les bénéfices lui permettront de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" of Medina Plateau was formed on February 19, 2001. This group always pays its loans back on time. It is made up of women who are in the business of selling fish products.

Awa, pictured on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is married, 52 years old, and the mother of 5 children (2 boys and 3 girls.) Awa has been selling fish products for more than 10 years. 

This loan will allow Awa to purchase fish which she will resell at the market. Awa has solid experience in her business. The income she earns will allow her to pay for her children's schooling, and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fish products

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
Neba is married with four children and they live in a five-room house in Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon. 

Neba has faced various problems in her life, ranging from the lack of concern shown by family members after the death of her mother and child, ill health, inadequate finance to provide standard education and medication for her family, together with poor sales. All this has hindered her a lot.
       
The new loan she has requested will be used to buy food items such as beans, Irish potatoes and yellow yams for retail sale. She is so optimistic that she will succeed because she has been running the business for quite some time and has got lots of experience and a good technique, coupled with the fact that her business is located in a strategic position with an availability of ready customers.     

The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, raise the standard of family well being, and provide for children's school fees, as well as to construct a house for her family. 

Neba prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rates with convenient repayment duration. They also offer non-financial services like training to manage business capital for success, and profit and loss account details. She also benefits from the ideas exchanged through monthly meetings and the social networking, and not leaving out the fact that she is constantly followed up for proper utilization of the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, beans and yellow yams

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
This is Consolacion. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Consolacion hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living condition of her family and give her grandchildren better education. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
She is Jocelyn. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy more grocery items, beverages, toiletries and other supplies needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 43,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of groceries and other merchandise items she needs to improve her business. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also enable her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Jocelyn wants to improve their present financial condition and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, toiletries and other grocery supplies.

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chanthoeun, a 52-year-old woman with eight children, lives in Prey Veng province. To support her family’s living conditions, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Chanthoeun leads a group of two members who are applying for a loan. She will use her loan portion to buy wood to build her house. She hopes that she can earn more money, raise her living standards and support all her children to get an education.

loans.use: to buy wood to build her house

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Bophapov's Group

texts.en: Bophapov, aged 27, is the mother of two children and lives in Kampong Cham province. She farms in a paddy field and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her first loan cycle with Vision Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. As the leader of her three-member group, Bophapov will spend her loan portion to purchase pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more money and use it as capital to expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 42 ans et vit à Wonyomé avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Abla vend des oranges dans les rues de son quartier et au marché. Abla s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour  commander des oranges, Abla demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et avoir un bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Abla is 42 years old and married. She lives in Wonyomé and has four children in her care. 

Abla sells oranges in the streets of her neighbourhood and at the market. She buys her supplies at the market four times a month.

Abla is requesting this loan to finance her order of oranges, so she can earn money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of oranges.

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr: Agée de 26 ans, Essenam est une femme mariée qui habite à Adidogomé avec un enfant dont elle prend minutieusement soin. Pour lui permettre une bonne vie éducative, Essenam vend des mèches dans une boutique et trouve son gain favorable. Essenam s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des mèches, Essenam nécessite ce prêt pour financer sa commande et réaliser plus de gains pour l’épanouissement de sa famille
texts.en:
Essenam is 26 years old and married. She lives in Adidogomé and has one child under her care, to whom she devotes a great deal of attention. To provide for her child's education, Essenam sells hair extensions in a shop and finds that she makes a good profit.

Essenam buys her supplies at the market twice a month. She needs this loan to finance her order and increase her income so her family can flourish.

loans.use: to buy five dozen sets of hair extensions.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
His name is Joey, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Irene, a homemaker, and they have one child who is an elementary student. Joey works hard to provide for his family.

Joey owns and operates his own jeepney transport service. He has a one-unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. 

Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, the jeepneys are packed with passengers. Jeepneys offer one of the cheapest ways of getting somewhere. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the Second World War and are still to be seen throughout the Philippines in many colors and all over the place. 

The Filipinos saw possibilities in these Jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these Jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. Jeepney transport service is one of the stable businesses in the Philippines. 

To help him continue operations of his business, Joey is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan that he will use for the maintenance of his jeepney. It is very important that his unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Joey hopes to buy another jeepney unit. He dreams of giving his child the best education. He prays for his and his passengers' safety on every trip. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his jeepney.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle, aged 55, is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nestor, a driver, and they have one child who is already a college student. Anabelle manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal household needs. 

Anabelle operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Anabelle earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from groceries, she also sells school supplies to earn additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 700 PHP a day. 

To help Anabelle continue operating her general store business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, sodas, etc. She is positive that this will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are the source from which they meet their daily needs. Anabelle thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her and for a good return on her investment for it will surely help fund her child's college education.

Anabelle hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She dreams of seeing her daughter become a professional some day. Anabelle faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, sodas, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is an active woman. At the moment she is busy with keeping, feeding and selling livestock.

Aziza participated in a three-day training course which was provided by IMON to women entrepreneurs. She got new ideas and a lot of information from the training and has decided to start a service business. She is planning to buy a sewing machine “Чайка” and a computer “Janome” to sew easily, quickly and with high quality. These machines will help her to sew better and will attract demand for the traditional women's dresses that she makes. 

Aziza is asking for financial support to buy the sewing machines and start her new business. She awaits Kiva lenders' mercy.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rosemarie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Rosemarie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Susana successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Susana's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng, a 37 year-old woman with two children, lives in Kampong Cham province. 

She grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to purchase pesticide, fertilizer and seed in order to support her farmland. 

She hopes that she can earn much more income and use it as capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide, fertilizer and seed in order to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Soeun's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Soeun is 38 years old and a mother of four children. 

She grows tobacco and corn and works as a chef. This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully paid back her past loan. 

She leads a group of three members to get a loan. She will spend her loan portion to purchase gasoline and fertilizer to support her business. She hopes that she can expand her current business and make more money.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and fertilizer to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Synan's Group

texts.en:
Synan is a 43-year-old woman with two children who lives in Kampong Cham province. She grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is her third loan cycle with Vision Fund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner, and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

Synan leads this group of six members in requesting a loan. She will spend her loan portion to purchase pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her current business and earn more money than last year.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a hard-working woman. Born into a family of farmers in 1995, she is married and lives with her family in their district. Gulnora gained much from her parents when she was a child, including learning the practice of keeping and feeding livestock. 

After her marriage, Gulnora did not have any activity but she wanted to be helpful and support her husband with their finances. Now, she is planning to open a new business keeping, feeding and selling livestock. She has a good place and good conditions for keeping animals at home. 

Gulnora is appealing to Kiva lenders for a loan to start her business as she needs to buy livestock. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Denia works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and general store businesses. Denia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Denia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ngwe

texts.en:
Ngwe is single and has five children. She lives in a one-room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She had some unfortunate situations in her life, including the deaths of her son and mother and the burglary of her warehouse. Ngwe knows that her business will succeed because she started long ago, has gained much experience, and has steady customers. Her business is centrally located in Food Market Bamenda where nearly all the communities’ members visit on daily basis. 
          
Ngwe requested a loan from GHAPE, which she will use to buy more fresh tomatoes, fish, peppers, and egusi seeds to sell. Her profits will be used to expand her business and provide education for her children. She will also buy farm land where she can cultivate some crops. Ngwe prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rate is low, the method of repayment is very simple, and the rules are easy to follow.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish, egusi seeds, tomatoes, and peppers

loans.name: 030919030004.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liệu operates a food stall selling fruit. Liệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liệu faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Liệu is 29 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Liệu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liệu has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liệu is the group leader of the 030919030004.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

With her business profit, Liệu hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el cibercafé. 
Él es emprendedor, independiente, optimista, paciente, comprensivo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de las ‘Cabañas’ ubicado al sur de la ciudad un área residencial y marginada, casas rústicas y antiguas muchas sin acceso a agua potable que conviven formando un lugar de manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima cálido con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-32 grados centígrados.
Reynaldo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos usa elntes de aumento, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres, que es propia y esta construida de ladrillo con techo de paja y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la atención de un cibercafé; donde tiene 6 computadoras conectadas en red y con acceso a internet, sus clientes vienen a jugar entre amigos, otros vienen solos a realizar la tarea de la escuela y otros llegan a distraerse navegando en la red. “inicie mi negocio después de un curso de ensamblado de computadoras y con 2 computadoras lentas comencé, ahora cuento con 6 y son de última generación…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es nuevo en el lugar y la gente de ahí no tiene acceso a otros cibercafés, la desventaja es la humedad que hace que los equipos se malogren. Su sueño es establecerse en la zona y ser el negocio más concurrido. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Reynaldo solicita un préstamo para la compra de 2 computadoras para aumentar los equipos de su negocio y atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 26 year old man, single, without children and his business is a cybercafé.

He is enterprising, independent, optimistic, patient, understanding, responsible and hardworking. His business is in “Cabañas” located in the southern part of the city, a marginalized residential area with rustic old houses, many without access to potable water, coexisting with manufacturing throughout the area. It has a warm climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 18-32 degrees Celsius.

Reynaldo has a dark complexion, with short black hair, brown eyes and wears glasses. He is of medium height, with a medium physique. His mother tongue of Guaraní is spoken in his area and he speaks conversational Spanish in general and for his business.

He lives at home with his parents in their own house which is made of bricks and has a thatched roof, potable water, electricity and a sewer system. 

His business is running a cybercafé. He has six networked computers with Internet access. Customers come to be with friends, others come alone to do homework, and others to entertain themselves surfing the web.

“I opened my business after a course in building computers and started with two slow computers and now I have six of the latest generation,” he says. The advantage of his business is that it is new in the area and people there do not have access to other cybercafés. The disadvantage is the humidity that makes the equipment malfunction.

His dream is to establish the busiest business in the area. This is his first loan with the institution in the three years since he began his business. It is for these reasons that Reynaldo is asking for a loan to buy two computers in order to increase his business equipment and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy 2 computers in order to increase his business equipment and serve more customers

loans.name: Komila

texts.en:
Komila is a seamstress and sews traditional dresses for women. She has about four years of experience sewing beautiful and modern dresses. She lives in a remote district with her family. She is a widow and has two children. She had a hard time after the death of her husband because it was not easy to keep a family and raise children. She has additional business activities keeping, feeding, and selling cattle. Operating her businesses from home helps her to look after her family. 

Her house is in poor condition, and she wants to renovate it. It is not easy to live there. She is planning to buy construction supplies for renovation. Komila requested a loan to buy construction materials to renovate her house. She awaits Kiva lenders' mercy.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: 030902060003.thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ operates a food stall selling processed food. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Huệ is 37 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Huệ is the group leader of group 030902060003, Thiệu Hóa solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2013, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Huệ hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Thôn 5.2 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Nhung works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the Nhóm 12 thôn 5.2 Quảng Nhân solidarity group.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhosm 13 Thôn 5.2 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs  Tình works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in future.

 Tình is 51 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 13 thôn 5.2 Quảng Nhân solidarity group. Tình lives  in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is  Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that  Tình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In future,  Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a Mpesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 65,000 KES loan to pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she hopes that she will be successful in business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be a risk taker. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a favorable location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the price fluctuations of milk and animal feeds. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy animal feeds. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a dressmaking school. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals and build a business stall. Her business goal is to have a large store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will generate wealth, educate her children and create employment. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals and build a business stall

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a male Kiva borrower. He has six children. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft of livestock.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cows and animal feeds. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cows and animal feeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 5 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand to a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she roasts maize. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more maize for roasting. Her business goal is to expand within five years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more maize for roasting

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo es un hombre de 24 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Tacanoca’ ubicada a las orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca a 3850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Los pobladores viven de la agricultura y la pesca, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados.
Marcelo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que son muy mayores de edad y no trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad, y agua de pozo.
