loans.name: Vicente Paul

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 62 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos y vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios.
El es un policia pasivo se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño solicita el credito para la compra de una maquina agricola ya que necesita para sus sembrios por que al estar alquilando es muy molestoso y se gasta mas recurso, gracias a este credito podra mejorar sus sembrios y optimizar los recursos. La compra realizara en Ventanas, su sueño es comprarse un carro en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Vicente is 62 years old and married, with four children.  He lives in Ventanas, in Los Ríos Province.  He is a retired policeman, and he has worked in agriculture since he was very young.  

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of an agricultural machine, as he needs it for his fields, and renting one is very bothersome and uses up more resources.  Thanks to this loan, he will be able to improve his fields and optimize resources. He will make the purchase in Ventanas. 

His dream is to purchase a car for himself. In his free time, he likes sports.

loans.use: to purchase an agricultural machine.

loans.name: Julia Judith

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Juventud y  Progreso se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
Aquí vive la señora Julia, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de  esta  relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer y comerciante.
Doña Julia es una mujer  que le gusta con su esfuerzo salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos por catalogo, sale a ofrecer su productos por la localidad, ella también le ayuda a su marido con el crédito quien  se dedica al comercio, el tiene un carro en el cual realiza fletes en la ciudad de Manta pero también en su carro  se desplaza junto con su esposa a las granjas donde compra pollos los mismos que luego entre los dos les pelan y salen a entregar a tiendas de la localidad o venden por libras en su casa. Llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar  pollos, zapatos y para arreglos del carro. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho a salir adelante ya que la situación es muy difícil. Sus sueños son comprar un carro nuevo.
texts.en:
The "Juventud y Progreso" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Los Bajos de Montecristi. This city is known for it's rich culture and for it's great handicrafts, an example being the nationally and internationally famous Panama hat.

Julia lives here. She is 46 years old, is in a common-law relationship and from this relationship has 5 adult children, two of whom still live at home. Her husband is a driver and a businessman. Julia is a woman who is happy with her efforts to get ahead. She works in commerce selling shoes by catalog. She goes out and offers her product in the area.

She also helps her husband who is a businessman with the loan. He has a vehicle which he uses to deliver freight in the city of Manta. But he also travels with his wife to farms where they buy chickens that they pluck and deliver to stores or sell by them pound at home. They have done this for 10 years to get ahead. This loan is to buy chickens, shoes and fix the car. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it as the loans allow her to get ahead as her situation is very difficult. Her dream is to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy chickens, shoes and repair her car.

loans.name: Digna Victoria

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Juventud y  Progreso se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Digna, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen  siete hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es albañil. 
Doña Digna es artesana, ella elabora una gran variedad de productos hechos en lana y croché, hace bolsos y carteras, muñecos de trapo los mismos que les adorna con bellos vestidos que ella misma elabora, aretes collares entre otras cosas, ella trabaja bajo pedido que le realizan sus clientes que saben lo bello de sus trabajos, esto le deja muy buenas ganancias que le sirven para salir adelante y mas en ocasiones que su marido no tiene mucho trabajo sus ganancias le sirven para su sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar lana, croché y otros materiales para elaborar sus obras. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque la fundación les da atención médica gratuita. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Juventud y Progreso community bank meets twice a month in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture.  The straw hats made by local craftsman here are famous in Ecuador and beyond.
Our member, Sra. Digna, is 50-years old.  She and her husband have seven children, two of whom still live at home.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Doña Digna is an artisan.  She operates a business making and selling all kinds of knitted wool products: bags; purses; rag dolls, some dressed in the doll clothes that she also makes; and much more.  She makes products to order for buyers who know the beauty of her work.  Her earnings from the business cover household expenses when her husband's work slows and help the family to get ahead.  
Doña Digna will use this loan to buy wool and other supplies for carrying on her business.  She has been a member of the group through 6 rounds of funding and likes it because they provide free medical care.  
For the future, she hopes to continue moving ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Maria De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
María es una viuda de 66 años de edad que debido a las necesidades económicas tan marcadas que dejo la partida de su esposo Inicio desde año 2013 un negocio de venta de productos de uso personal para tratar de solventarlas y llevar un plato de comida a su hogar.

Es madre de 4 hijos los cuales tratan de ayudar a su madre en todo lo que pueden y la motivan mucho pues se siente muy feliz realizando esta actividad dado que lo cataloga como una distracción una forma de vida y un medio de mantenimiento.

María con su negocio busca primeramente sostenibilidad del negocio, con ello podrá operar y solventar las necesidades de primer grado, como alimento, transporte y pago de servicios públicos, una vez logre eso podrá explorar un poco más para ganar capital pero quiere llevar su empresa a pasos cortos pero seguros.

María solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido de productos de uso personal como lo son:
•	Productos capilares
•	Productos faciales
•	Desodorantes
•	Productos de decoración como papales, bolsas de regalos, bombas, serpentinas etc.
•	Accesorios.
texts.en:
María is a 66-year-old widow who, because of economic necessity after her husband's passing, started her own business selling personal use products in 2013 in order to cancel debts and provide food for her household. She is the mother of 4 children, all of whom try to help their mother in any way that they can and motivate her greatly. She is happy with her business because she feels that it is a distraction, a way of life, and a way to support herself. 

María is looking to make her business sustainable first and foremost. She will be able to operate and pay for primary necessities like food, transportation, and public utilities. Once she pays for these things, she will be able to explore other ways to earn capital, but she wants to move her business forward with small, secure steps.

María requests a loan that she will use to purchase a stock of personal use products like hair removal products, facial products, deodorants, accessories, and decorative products (papers, gift bags, streamers, party balloons, etc.).

loans.use: to purchase personal use products to sell at her business

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: FLORA: Es una señora luchadora de 41 años de edad, originaria de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia Miskita. Se trasladó a Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas, familia, con la esperanza de mejorar sus condiciones de vida para su familia. Está casada con 6 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y 3 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y primaria. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad. Desde hace un año alquila un cuarto, pagando una mensualidad de C$800 (Ochocientos Córdobas Netos). Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar un terreno e iniciar a construir poco a poco su vivienda de tambo y madera, comprar materiales de construcción: Postes de maderas, madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su esposo sueñan con llegar a tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Flora, 41, is a hardworking woman. She is originally from Waspam and belongs to the Miskita people. She and her family moved to Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas, with the hope of improving their living conditions. She is married and has six children. Three of them are adults, and three are teenagers and go to secondary and primary school. Her husband works as a security guard. They have been renting a room for a year, and pay 800 Nicaraguan Córdobas [NIO].

Flora is requesting a loan for the first time. She will buy a plot of land and start to build, little by little, a wooden stilt home. She will also buy construction materials such as wooden poles, dimensional lumber, nails and zinc sheets, and pay for the labor. She and her husband dream of having a house of their own.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and build a wooden stilt home.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes artesanales.
Ella es buen madre, dedicada, emprendedora, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en un mercado de la zona Sur de la ciudad, área residencial y muy poblada, casas rústicas, antiguas,  muchas sin acceso a servicios básicos, conviven formando un lugar de manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima cálido con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 22-32 grados centígrados. 
Marisa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a los negocios y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes artesanales e importados. Los juguetes artesanales, mayormente son fabricados de madera, llevan colores llamativos y vienen en forma de; automóvil, rompecabezas, cubos, muñecos y otros, son juguetes que además de ser artesanales desarrollan la inteligencia del niño al momento de armar o desarmar. También oferta juguetes importados como; muñecas, muñecos, autos, etc. “los artesanos son los que fabrican estos juguetes y nos dejan por mayor, los clientes son padres de familia que compran para sus niños pequeños…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es muy concurrido y las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es que existe mucha competencia. Su sueño es poseer una cadena de jugueterías, ella desea realizar la compra de juguetes artesanales para contar con mayor oferta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marisa solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de juguetes artesanales para ofertar, mejorar su ventas y ayudar a los artesanos.
texts.en:
Marisa, 33 years old, lives with her partner and has two children aged 15 and eight. She is a good mother, is dedicated, resourceful, patient, responsible, and she works hard.

Her business is the sales of handcrafted toys in a market located in the southern end of the city. This is an area where residents mingle forming a manufacturing center, a highly populated residential area, with rustic, old homes, many without access to basic utilities. The weather is warm with daytime temperatures ranging from 22 to 32 degrees centigrade. 

Marisa has a dark complexion and long black hair that she wears in a ponytail. She has brown eyes, is short and of medium build. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish in the community and for business. 

She shares her life with her partner, who works, and her two children who go to school. They live in their own home made of bricks and cement with a tin roof. They have well water and electricity. 

She works selling handcrafted and imported toys. The handmade toys are mostly crafted of wood in bright colors, in the form of cars, jigsaw puzzles, cubes, dolls, and more. These toys are not only artisan products but also made to develop the child's motor skills. She also offers for sale imported toys such as dolls, cars, and more.

"The artisans making these toys supply us wholesale," she comments, "the clients are parents buying for their children".
The advantage of her business is high foot traffic and steady sales, the disadvantage is the highly competitive market.

 Marisa is requesting the loan to purchase a variety of handcrafted toys in order to expand her stock, improve her sales, and support the artisans. 

Her dream is to own a toy store chain. This is her first loan with the institution in the year that she's been doing this work.

loans.use: to buy a variety of handcrafted toys to sell, in order to improve her sales and support the local artisans.

loans.name: Sire's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12 Novembre 2011, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Il existe une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Siré assise (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, veuve et mère de 04  enfants (02 garçons et 02 filles).Elle s’active dans la vente de chaussures, de parures et de tissus qu’elle achète à Dakar pour les revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus d’une valeur de 250000f et  75 paires de chaussures à 2000f  la paire pour les revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de développer ses activités et d’assurer le quotidien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on November 12, 2011 and is composed of very energetic women who have a good rapport among them. The group members mainly work as vendors.

Mrs. Siré (the one seated on the far right raising her right hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 44 yeas old, a widow and has four children: two sons and two daughters. She sells shoes, jewelry and fabric, which she buys in Dakar in order to resell retail in her neighborhood.

With this loan,  Siré plans to buy fabric valued at 250,000 West African francs and 75 pairs of shoes at 2,000 francs in order to resell retail.
The resulting revenues will allow her to grow her business and provide for the everyday needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12 Novembre 2011, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Il existe une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Khady (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 47ans et mère de 01 garçon et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide, d’huile de palme et de légumes et du jus de citron qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 bouteille de  20 litre d’huile de palme à 1000f le litre 04 sceaux de 20 kg de patte d’arachide à 8500f le sceau et 02 bidons de 20 litre de citrons à 350f le litre  pour les revendre au marché central en détails.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte acheter un terrain et le construire pour ses enfants
texts.en:
Created on November 12, 2011, this group is composed of very active women, who get along well within the group. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Khady (sitting at the far right with her right hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is married, 47 years old, and the mother of a boy and a girl. She is active in selling peanut butter, palm oil, vegetables, and lemon juice, which she buys at the weekly markets. 

With this new loan, she intends to purchase four 20-liter bottles of palm oil at 1,000 francs per liter; four 20-kg pails of peanut butter at 8.500 francs per pail; and two 20-liter containers of lemon juice at 350 francs per liter. These goods will be resold at the central market. 

With the profits, she plans to buy a plot of land and to build on it for her children.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, peanut butter, and lemon juice

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12 Novembre 2011, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Il existe une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadiatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 27 ans, marié et mère de 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de chaussures, de tissus qu’elle achète à Dakar.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 40 paires de chaussures à 1000f la paire et des tissus d’une valeur de 100 000  pour les revendre dans son quartier en détails
.
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’acheter un terrain et de participer à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
Created on November 12, 2011, this group is composed of very active women, who get along well within the group. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Kadiatou (sitting at the far right with her right hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is 27 years old and a married mother of four boys. She is active in selling shoes and fabrics that she purchases from Dakar. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase 40 pairs of shoes at 1,000 francs per pair and some fabrics valued at 100,000 francs to resell in her neighborhood at the retail level. 

The profits from her business will enable her to purchase a plot of land and to help with day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and fabrics to resell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Juan Cesar

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 2 y 1 año,  su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es buen padre, independiente, paciente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la carretera a ‘Viacha’ que se caracteriza por ser de 3 kilómetros; es la primera de la ciudad que tiene 8 carriles y construida con  pavimento rígido. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Juan es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja, con su mamá que se ocupa del hogar y con sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar, viven en una casa de la familia, construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cerrajería, él se encarga de fabricar puertas, ventanas, portones y también realiza el techado de construcciones con calamina. “inicié mi negocio como ayudante de mi tío, luego tuve familia y me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la comodidad de su taller amplio y bien ubicado, la desventaja es cuando recibe pedidos contrata ayudantes y estos no son constantes. Su sueño es tener un taller de cerrajería, conocido, él desea realizar la compra de planchas de metal para la fabricación de portones para garaje de autos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de planchas de metal para fabricar portones de garaje.
texts.en:
Juan, age 30, lives with his life partner.  He has two sons, ages two and one.  He has a metal working business.  He is a good father, independent, patient, tenacious, energetic, responsible, and hard-working.

He conducts his business on the road to ‘Viacha’, which is known for being three kilometers.  It is the first in the city to have eight lanes, and it is built with concrete pavement.  The climate is cold and dry, and the temperature varies between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Juan has a dark complexion, short black hair, brown eyes, and is medium height and thin.  His mother tongue is Ayamará, which he speaks in this place.  He speaks Spanish with the general public and for the business that he conducts.  He shares his life with his wife, who works; with his mother, who cares for the household; and with his children, who are not yet school age.  They live in the family house, which is made from brick and cement and has a corrugated metal roof.  They have running water, electricity, gas services, and indoor plumbing.

He has a metal working business.  He makes doors, windows, and gates.  He also makes roofing from corrugated metal.  “I started my business as a helper to my uncle.  Then I had my family, and I became independent,” he says.  The advantage to his business is the convenience of his big shop and its good location.  The disadvantage is that when he receives orders he hires helpers, and they are not steady.

His dream is to have a well-known metal working shop.  He wishes to buy sheet metal to make garage doors.  This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the five years that he has been independently engaged in this business activity.

It is for these reasons that Juan is requesting a loan to buy sheet metal to make garage doors.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal to make garage doors.

loans.name: Sáu

texts.en:
Mrs. Sáu works in agriculture farming food.

Sáu is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Sáu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Sáu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Sáu faces in her life is not having money to build a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Sáu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: 020103360001Bắc Sơn Xã Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. Nga has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to make sauce for sale.

In 2014, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nga has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nga is the group leader of the 020103360001Bắc Sơn Xã Hoằng Phụ solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

Nga is 32 years old, and she is married with two children. Nga lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In the future, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make sauce for sale

loans.name: Nhóm 17-Phú Thọ 2-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai has a service business shipping goods. She is requesting a loan to repair the vehicle she uses for shipping goods.

Mai is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mai is the group leader of the Nhóm 17-Phú Thọ 2-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members.

In 2010, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mai has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle she uses for her shipping business.

loans.name: Hạng

texts.en:
Mr. Hạng works in agriculture, farming food. Hạng has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Hạng is 43 years old, and he is married with three children. He lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hạng’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hạng faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With his business profit, Hạng hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and for his children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: 020305130003 Liên Hà - Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Hương is 63 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hương is the group leader of the 020305130003 Liên hà - Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of eight members.

In 2003, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết has a service business cutting hair. Tuyết has been involved in this business for nine years.

Tuyết is 29 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyết’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Tuyết hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mr. Hà works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Hà has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Hà is 41 years old, and he is married with three children. He lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hà’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hà faces in his life is not having a latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Hà hopes for his children to do well in school, for his children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has a service business, tailoring clothes. Nga has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Nga is 44 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her children to find a good job, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lý

texts.en:
Lý has a retail business selling dry food.

Lý is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lý has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build toilet.

With her business profits, Lý hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rebeca Soledad

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa familiar con su madre, tía y hermano, su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como patos y pavos, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 05 años contando con experiencia en este sector y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Rebeca espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 29, is single and lives in her family home with her mother, sister, and brother, and they are a close-knit family.  She lives in a community in the Zaña district, Chiclayo province,  Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast. The residents are hardworking people engaged in farming and ranching.  

Rebeca is engaged in raising small animals such as ducks and turkeys.  She has been engaged in this business for five years so she has experience in this sector and good references from her neighbors.  The purpose of the loan is to buy more animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them.  In this way, Rebeca hopes to offer her customers a wider variety of animals, which will generate greater income, and permit her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Hằng

texts.en:
Hằng works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She is 25 years old and she is married with 1 child. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hằng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. With her business profits, Hằng hopes for her business to do well and to make enough money to provide for her kid.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Vicente Hermogenes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Juventud y  Progreso se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive don Vicente, tiene 54 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tienen  seis hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
El señor Vicente es un hombre muy trabajador que le ha tocado esforzarse mucho para darles a su familia lo mejor, él se dedica al  comercio, tiene un camión en el cual  vende ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), madera,  leña y otros materiales, también se desplaza a otras ciudades donde le piden estos productos, el trabaja 4 días por semana y gracias a los créditos todo se le hace más fácil ya que puede financiar su negocio por lo cual está muy agradecido con la fundación y con las personas que hacen posible que el pueda recibir su crédito.
Este crédito es para comprar  madera,  ladrillos y leña que el vende. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Juventud y Progreso community bank meets twice a month in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture.  The straw hats made by local craftsman here are famous in Ecuador and beyond.
Our member, Don Vicente, is 54-years old.  He and his wife have six children including two--16- and 14-years old, respectively--still in school.  His wife takes care of their home and family.  Sr. Vicente makes a living buying and selling construction materials: lumber, bricks, etc.  He has a truck for hauling the materials and can fill orders here and in other parts of the country.  He works 4 days a week and says that he is grateful for past loans because they have helped him build his business.  He work hard because he wants the best for his family.
Don Vicente will use this loan to buy lumber, bricks and other construction materials for resale.  He has been a member of the group since it started and likes its straight-forward loan process.
For the future, he wants to provide for his family in the best way that he can.

loans.use: to stock his construction materials business.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Juventud y  Progreso se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella estudia enfermería en un centro  de la localidad. Lleva 5 ciclos   en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante y continuar con sus estudios.
Doña María además de estudiar se dedica al comercio para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su mama con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también les vende a sus compañeras de clases las que son sus mejores clientes, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 1  año que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo necesario para continuar con sus estudios, ella está muy agradecida con la institución y con las organizaciones y personas que hacen posible que ella pueda recibir los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Juventud y Progreso community bank meets twice a month in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture.  The straw hats made by local craftsman here are famous in Ecuador and beyond.
Our member, Srta. María, is 23-years old.  She is single and lives with her parents.  She is studying nursing at a local college.  She has been a member of the group through 5 cycles and likes it because past loans have helped her to continue her studies and get ahead.  Separate from her studies, Doña María operates a clothing sales business.  She started the business to earn an income of her own and to help her mother with household expenses.  She sells all kinds of clothing, often going door to door to find new buyers.  Her best customers, though, are her classmates.  She sells her merchandise on credit and collects from her buyers every eight days.  She has operated the business for a year and is earning enough to cover her school expenses.  She is grateful, she says, to everyone who has made it possible for her to borrow the funds she has needed to build her business.
Doña María will use this loan to stock her clothing sales business.
Her greatest hope for the future is to complete her studies.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Grace operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Grace dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Marvill Antonio

texts.es: MARVILL ANTONIO: Es un hombre emprendedor, originario de la comunidad de Nazareth, que se localiza a 65 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casado 2 hijos: El mayor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal y con el deseo de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 10 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda. Solicita su primer financiamiento para surtir más su pulpería y de esa manera también mejorar sus ingresos. Ella vende granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, gaseosas, chiverías entre otros productos básicos. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio prospero, establecer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Marvill Antonio is an enterprising man, a native of the community of Nazareth located some 65 kilometers from Puerto Cabezas municipality. He is married with two children. The older child is 6 years old and studies in the first grade of primary school, while the younger is just three years old. 

Due to the local lack of formal employment, and with the desire to advance his family, some ten years ago Marvill established a small general store in the hallway of his house. Now, he is soliciting his first financing to better supply his store with merchandise in order to increase his income. The store sells basic grains, soap, detergents, soft drinks and snacks, among other basic products.

Marvill dreams of having a prosperous business and establishing a distributorship.

loans.use: to expand the merchandise in his general store.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es:
Pedro un hombre nacido y criado con las costumbres del campo, donde la tierra y la familia pasan hacer parte de tu familia, vives por el campo y el campo vive por ti, es un agricultor de 44 años de edad, padre de dos hijos adolescentes, opera un negocio heredado de generación en generación y aspira a que en un futuro uno de sus hijos se haga carga de las tierras.
 Es un hombre que trabaja la increíble cantidad de 14 horas por día, dando vueltas al campo, abonándolos, quitando malezas y múltiples actividades que conforma una cotidianidad laboral.
En su cultivo siempre se ha soñado con poder emplear personas, ampliar sus cultivos, optimizar su operación pero ha ido llevando esto poco a poco debido al alto costo de los insumos agrícolas que no puede pagar.
Pensado en cumplir más que sus sueños sus metas, el señor pedro quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual lo invertirá de la siguiente manera.
•	Compra de semillas para ampliar un poco sus cultivos
•	Compra de alambres para delimitar su territorio y no haya conflictos con sus vecinos 
•	Compra de abonos, riegos, y gallinaza.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Giáp

texts.en:
Mr. Giáp has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. Giáp has been involved in this business for five years.

Giáp is 25 years old, and he is married with one child. He lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Giáp’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Giáp faces in his life is not having a latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Giáp hopes to buy land of his own, for his business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh works in agriculture farming food.

Hạnh is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hạnh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Xinh works in agriculture, farming food. Xinh has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Xinh is 51 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Xinh’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Xinh faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Xinh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nguyệt

texts.en:
Nguyệt works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Forty-five years old, she is married with 2 children and lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nguyệt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build such a system. 

With her business profits, Nguyệt hopes to buy a motorbike, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a biogas system

loans.name: Lý

texts.en:
Mr. Lý operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Lý has been involved in this business for nine years.

Lý is 31 years old, and he is married with three children. He lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lý’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lý faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Lý hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Châu

texts.en:
Mrs. Châu works in agriculture, farming food. Châu has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Châu is 27 years old, and she is married with two children. She supports two dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Châu’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Châu faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Châu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên operates a food stall/restaurant that sells fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build such a toilet.

With her business profits, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hóa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hóa works in agriculture farming food.

Hóa is 51 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hóa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hóa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hóa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hóa hopes for her business to do well and hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cesar Yovany

texts.es:
Cesar Yovany tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, pollos y cuyes, adicionalmente el se dedica a labores de jornalería en la zona rural de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales así como para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como peón agrícola, y así tener una mejor producción para ofrece a sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos lo que mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar Yovany is 39 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún. The population here works in agriculture, trade and cattle. It is located two hours outside of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

Along with his wife, he raises and sells animals such as ducks, chickens and guinea pigs. He also works as a day laborer in the rural area of his district.

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase balanced feed for his animals as well as purchase tools for his agricultural work. These items will help him to improve production and increase his earnings, which will help to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase feed for his animals and to purchase agricultural tools.

loans.name: Nhóm 02  Phú Thọ 3 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 43 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 02  Phú Thọ 3 Phú Sơn 2 Solidarity Group. Thủy lives  in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam.

Thủy operates a food stall selling poultry. She has been in this business for six years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2012, Thủy joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her  business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to sell at her food stall. Thủy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Giải Trại Xã Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thư works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thư is 52 years old and she is married with three children. Thư is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Giải Trại Xã Công Chính solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

This is Thư's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thư has been involved in her current business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thư hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn Giải Trại Xã Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tú works in agriculture raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Tú is 50 years old, and she is married with one child. Tú is the group leader of Nhóm 11 Thôn Giải Trại Xã Công Chính, a solidarity group which consists of five members. 

This is Tú's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Tú has been involved in her current business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tú faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tú hopes to maintain a successful business. She wishes for her business to do well and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 15 Phú Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa works in agriculture raising poultry. Hoa has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hoa is 63 years old and she is married with three children. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 15 Phú Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry

loans.name: Wuilian

texts.es:
Wuilian tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas como peón trabajando en los diversos cultivos de su distrito y zonas cercanas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 18 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan buenas referencias de el. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de sus herramientas así como para la compra de herramientas nuevas, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wuilian is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, has two children, and lives in his family's home in a rural zone of Oyotun District, Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast.

Wuilian offers agricultural services as a laborer in the diverse crops of his district and nearby zones. He has dedicated himself to these activities since the age of 18, including experience in the business side, and he has fixed group of clients who offer him good references.

Wuilian is requesting a loan to repair and maintain his tools, and to purchase new tools. With this loan, he hopes to offer better services to his clients. This should have a positive impact on his level of income and, finally, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs and perform maintenance on his tools, and to purchase new tools.

loans.name: James

texts.es:
James tiene 39 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería como peón agrícola, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años, cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas como son palanas, sogas, entre otros, para realizar su trabajo, esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
James is 39 years old, single and lives in his own home in the district of Oyotún. This district is located in the province of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru. The people here make a living in agriculture and raising animals.

James works as a day laborer, an activity he has been doing for 10 years. He has good references from the people in the area.

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase tools like shovels and ropes to help him better do his job. The tools will help him offer a better service which will have a positive impact on his earnings and his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase tools like shovels, ropes and more.

loans.name: Idd

texts.en:
Idd is a married mother of two children, both attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the 40,000 KES, Idd wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Luz Enith

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer enérgica, guiada de sus instintos, muy correcta en su forma de trabajar, tiene un excelente trato con los clientes y con su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas trata de sacar a su familia adelante, luchar por un futuro, por sus dos hijas que estudien, que trabajen que se formen como buenos seres humanos aportantes a la sociedad. 

Esperanzada en una mejor calidad de vida, en cosas buenas para su familia Luz quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en el arreglo de su puesto de comida, comprar surtido para la preparación de hamburguesas, perros calientes, carnes con de todo, chorizos, carne asada, papas a la francesa entre otros. 

Con la ayuda de este préstamo la señora Luz podrá abastecer su negocio, reparar su puesto de alimentos y seguir en vía de progreso.
texts.en:
Luz is an energetic woman, guided by her instincts, and very precise in her work. She treats her customers very well and moves her family forward with her fast food sales business. She fights for the future, for her children to attend school, and for her children to become good, productive members of society.

She hopes for a better quality of life and good things for her family, so Luz wants to request a loan, which she will invest in repairing her food stand and purchasing supplies to make hamburgers, hot dogs, meat with everything, sausages, roast beef, French fries, and other things. With the help of this loan, Luz will be able to stock her business, repair her food stall, and continue making progress.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make hamburgers, hot dogs, meat with everything, sausages, roast beef, French fries, etc.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro tiene un negocio de chatarrería, un negocio que acogió por  la necesidad de trabajo de momento, el compra la chatarra la cual junta y posteriormente vende pro montos grandes, en pocas palabras es un mayorista.

Ramiro es un hombre trabajar, honesto, arriesgado, muy protector un negocio que aprendió empíricamente y que adopto por necesidad ante la urgencia de generar recursos para sostener a su familia conformada por sus dos hijos adolescentes.

Solicita un préstamo para tener capital de trabajo y comprar la chatarra que personas del común, incluso habitantes de la calle le ofrecen, creando una red de trabajo y oportunidad a dichas personas tan necesitadas.
texts.en:
Ramiro has a scrap metal business, which he started because he needed a job. He purchases scrap metal, which he joins and sells in large quantities. In short, he is a wholesaler. 

Ramiro is a hardworking, honest, risk taking, protector. He learned his business through experience and started it due to the urgent need to generate resources to support his family, including his two teenaged children.

He requests a loan for working capital, which he will use to purchase scrap metal from community members, including homeless individuals, creating a network of jobs and opportunities for needy individuals.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal to improve his business with primary materials.

loans.name: Vicky Edelmira

texts.es: VICKY EDELMIRA: Es una joven alegre y jovial de 25 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 8 años cursa su cuarto grado de primaria y un pequeño de 2 años de edad. Con gran esfuerzo, desde hace 7 años poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda (madera y concreto) Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: Bloques, cemento, hierro, arena y  cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Vicky Edelmira is a happy young woman who is 25 years old, married and mother of two. The oldest of her children is 8 and attends grade school, her youngest is only 2. Through great efforts, she began building her own home 7 years ago. Her home is made of wood and concrete. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase construction material such as cinder blocks, cement, iron, sand and to cover labor costs. Her dream is to finish building her home.

loans.use: purchase construction materials like cement, iron, sand and labor costs.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es: Mayra tiene 30 años de edad, Mayra arrienda un cuarto donde atiende su negocio desde hace  8 años  atrás, Mayra vive con sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería y comenta que hicieron un gran esfuerzo para darle la educación en belleza y peluquería, Mayra va  a invertir su crédito en la comprar productos de peluquería,  bisutería, cuidados de la piel y mas productos que ofrece en su local, Mayra tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando en su negocio al que se dedica con mucho amor y de las ganancias que le deje su negocio piensa repartir una parte para incrementar mercadería  y la otra parte para ayudar el lo que necesiten sus padres ya que Mayra es agradecida con ellos por haberle dado la educación y ahora poder laborar en su peluquería.
texts.en:
Mayra is 30 years old.  She rents a room where she has been running her business for eight years.  Mayra lives with her parents, who work in agriculture and livestock-raising, and she comments that they made a great effort to give her an education in beauty and hairstyling. Mayra is going to invest her loan in purchasing hair products, costume jewelry, skincare, and other products that she sells in her shop. 

Mayra aspires to keep working in her business, to which she devotes herself with much love. She plans to set aside part of the earnings from her business to increase merchandise and the other part to help her parents with what they need, as Mayra is grateful to them for having given her an education, and now she can work in her hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair products.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: JUAN: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, es un hombre luchador, casado con 4 hijos en edad escolar. El mayor de 15 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria, 2 adolescentes que cursan su primaria y un pequeño de 6 meses. Desde hace 10 años habita en una casa de tambo y madera, con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en: Juan lives in Puerto Cabezas.  He is a hard-working man with 4 school-aged children: a 15-year old in high school; 2 younger children in primary school; and a six-month old baby.  He has lived in a timber "casa de tambo" [a simple house built on a raised platform, usually for protecting the house from flooding] for 10 years.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to improve the house and give his family a safe and decent place to live.  The investment will cover the costs of the labor and materials--lumber, nails, etc.--that he needs to carry out the work.  For the future, he hopes to have a house of sturdier, more durable concrete.

loans.use: to cover costs of labor and materials for housing improvements.

loans.name: Kena Ellieth

texts.es: KENA ELLIETH: Es una señora cordial de 36 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos: El mayor de 16 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria, 2 adolescentes que cursan su primaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Desde  hace 22 años habitan en una casa de minifalda (madera y cemento), que actualmente necesita reparación. Solicita su primer financiamiento para  cambiar madera y algunas paredes de cemento que están con fisuras, comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos, cemento, hierro y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su esposo sueñan con cercar su vivienda, por mayor seguridad para sus hijos y brindarles mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Kena Ellieth, 36, is married and has 4 children: a 16-year old in high school; 2 younger children in primary school; and a 4-year old.  She has lived in a "minifalda" [a timber and cement house] for 22 years.  The house needs repairs and she is applying for her first loan to replace the timbers and broken cement walls.  The investment will cover the costs of the labor and materials--lumber, nails, cement, iron bar, etc.--that she needs to carry out the work.  She and her husband hope to enclose the house completely so that it's safer and more comfortable for their children.

loans.use: to cover the costs of labor and materials for housing improvements.

loans.name: Valita

texts.es: VALITA ISIDORA: Es una señora sonriente y amable de 44 años de edad, originaria de la comunidad de Kamla; que se localiza aproximadamente a 20 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas.  Esta casada, tiene 7 hijos: 5 son mayores de edad e independiente, y 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria  y primaria respectivamente. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado a construir su vivienda de minifalda (cemento y madera). Está solicitando financiamiento para construir un anexo que será utilizado como cuarto para sus hijos, comprar materiales de construcción: madera rústica, madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Valita Isidora is a smiling and kind woman, who is 44 years old and native of the community of Kamla, located 20 kilometers from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has 7 children: 5 of them are adults and independent, and two are teenagers who attend high school and elementary school respectively. With great effort, little by little, she has started building her house with a cement base and wooden walls (minifalda). She is requesting a loan to build an addition that will be used as a room for her children, to buy building materials: rustic wood, planed timber, nails, zinc, and to pay for labor costs. She and her husband dream of having a concrete house that will have the best conditions for their children, and specially that is safe.

loans.use: to build an addition that will be used as bedroom for her children.

loans.name: Tùng

texts.en:
Tùng works in agriculture, farming food. Tùng has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Tùng is 56 years old, and she is married with five children. She lives with three dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tùng’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Tùng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tùng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 24 Thôn Lý Đông Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Hiệp works in agriculture raising pigs. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. 

Hiệp is 29 years old, and she is married with two children. Hiệp is the group leader of the Nhóm 24 Thôn Lý Đông Xã Thăng Bình, a solidarity group which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiệp has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiệp has been involved in her current business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her children to do well in school and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hằng has been involved in her current business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her business to continue to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school.

Siêng is 53 years old and she is married with three children.

Siêng is the group leader of the Nhóm 17 Minh Phú, Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In the future, Siêng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 19 Thắng Hùng Hải Lộc Group

texts.en: Nhung is 28 years old, and she is married with two children. Nhung is the group leader of the 19 Thắng Hùng Hải Lộc Solidarity Group, which consists of seven members. For five years, Nhung has operated a food stall/restaurant selling cake, sweets, sugar, milk, and other items. The main hardship Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2014, Nhung joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase items to sell at her food stall. Nhung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nhung hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Nhóm 84 Thành Lập Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en: Đào is 53 years old, and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the NHóm 84 Thành Lập Ngư Lộc Solidarity Group.  For 10 years, Đào has operated a food stall/restaurant selling seafood. The main hardship Đào faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2014, Đào joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to sell at her food stall. Đào has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Đào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Ngọc Tháp Xã Hoàng Giang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood to make wood furniture to sell.

Thúy is 47 years old, and she is married with two children. Thúy is the group leader of Nhóm 02 Thôn Ngọc Tháp Xã Hoàng Giang, a solidarity group which consists of 3 members. 

This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thúy has been involved in the furniture-making business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to maintain a successful business. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make wood furniture to sell.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng works in agriculture, farming food.

Thắng is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thắng has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete construction of rental houses.

loans.name: Metsilen

texts.en:
Metsilen is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Metsilen is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Metsilen has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Turdigul

texts.ru: Турдигул 19 летняя жительница не большого района под названием Вахш. Она живет вместе с родителями и сестренкой. Турдигул недавно начала занимается растениеводством. В этом году она хочет посадить картошку. Но так как ее денежных средств не хватает на покупку семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений, она обратилась за кредитом. Турдигул надеется, что ей смогут предоставить кредит, она реализует посев и будет в ожидании сбора урожая.
texts.en: Turdigul is a 19-year-old resident of a small district, called Vakhsh. She lives with her parents and sister. Turdigul recently got involved in agriculture. This year she wants to plant potatoes, but because she does not have enough money to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers, she requested a loan. Turdigul hopes to receive this loan, plant the crop and wait to gather the harvest.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 12 y 17 años, y su negocio es la fabricación y venta de muebles.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, de buen actitud, optimista, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, ubicado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes del todo el país se asentaron en el lugar y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-36 grados centígrados. 
Edith es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela, el menor aún no está en edad escolar. Su negocio es la fabricación y venta de todo tipo de muebles de madera, como; mesas, sillas, roperos, pupitres, estantes, etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la zona. “mi carpintería cuenta con lo básico y necesario para trabajar, cuento con clientes constantes que me realizan pedidos…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que es libre y puede cuidar a su hijo menor el tiempo que desee, la desventaja es que los muebles son pesados y debe transportarlos sola. Su sueño es tener una tienda de muebles, ella desea realizar la compra de varios tipos de madera, como; mara, roble, pino y otros, para fabricar diferentes muebles. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Edith solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes tipos de madera para fabricar muebles, venderlos y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Edith is a 36-year-old woman, is single, and has 3 children, ages 2, 12, and 17. She makes and sells furniture for a living. She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, has a good attitude, and is optimistic, supportive, responsible, and hardworking. She developed her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood, which is characterized by its Aymara, Quechua, and Guarani populations. It is located in the southern part of the city and migrants from all parts of the country settled there and formed a great market. It has a tropical climate with a temperature that varies from 18-36 degrees Celsius throughout the da. 

Edith is dark-skinned, has long dark hair that she ties up, brown eyes, is short statured, and has a robust figure. Her native language is Guarani, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in the community and for commercial purposes. She shares her life with her three children, who attend school, except for the youngest, who is not yet school-aged. 

Her business involves making and selling all types of furniture, like tables, chairs, wardrobes, desks, shelves, and other things. She sells her products on foot in different area markets. She tells us, "I have the basic, necessary supplies for carpentry and I have regular customers that order products from me." The advantage of her job is that she has free time and she can care for her youngest son whenever she needs to. The disadvantage is that the furniture is heavy and she has to transport them alone.

Her dream is to have a furniture store. She would like to purchase different types of wood like mara, oak, pine, and others in order to fabricate different types of furniture. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 6 years that she has had this business. For the reasons above, Edith has requested a loan to purchase different types of wood to make furniture, to sell furniture, and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase different types of wood to manufacture furniture, to sell furniture, and to send her children to school.

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru:
Хаитгулу 49 лет. Она вместе с двумя сыновьями и невесткой проживает на районе Вахш. Она занимается скотоводством и на сегодняшний день данная деятельность является единственным источником доха в их семью. Старший сын Хаитгул учится в Университете, и она очень гордится своим сыном. Хаитгул верит, что сможет собрать средства и дать младшему сыну шанс получить высшее образование. Она старается, чтобы ее дети были образованными, нашли себе работу по специальности и стали успешными людьми. 
   Хаитгул обратилась за кредитом, с целью расширения животноводческой деятельности. Она планирует расширить поголовья скотов, увеличить доход и обеспечить детям светлое будущее. Она заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
Haitgul is 49 years old. She, her two sons and a daughter-in-law live in the Vakhsh district. She is involved in animal husbandry, which is currently her family's sole source of income. Haitgul's oldest son attends a university, and she is very proud of him. Haitgul believes that she will save enough money to give her youngest son an opportunity to pursue higher education. She tries to make sure that her children will become educated, find work in their professions and become successful people.

Haitgul requested this loan to expand her animal husbandry business. She plans to increase her livestock headcount, grow her income and provide a bright future for her children. She thanks You for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount and expand her business

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan works in agriculture farming food.

Nhan is 35 years old and married with four children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nhan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nhan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Nhan hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Tân Chính Xã Công Chính Group

This is Thuận's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thuận has been involved in the poultry business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her children to do well in school and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 020306110004 Đại Long Xã Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
