Mrs Hợp has a manufacturing business, making wood furniture. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hợp faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Hợp lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is 54 years old and she is married with three children. In 2011, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hợp has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to make wood furniture to sell.

Hợp is the group leader of the 020306110004 Đại Long Xã Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

With her business profit, Hợp hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to make wood furniture

loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Hòa is 32 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives and works in the Hau Loc district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hòa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in her current business for four years. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. 

Hòa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fruit.

Nga is 32 years old and she is married, with four children. She supports four dependents with her business in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Chín

texts.en:
Chín works in agriculture farming food.

Chín is 44 years old and married with five children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Chín joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Chín has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Chín faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Chín hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sheilla

texts.en:
Sheilla is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past five years, Sheilla has operated a cosmetic selling business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a food stall business selling from home, which acts as another source of income. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation in her business. Sheilla dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of cosmetics and foodstuff for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cosmetics and foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Jhon Arbey

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre de 45 años de edad, muy hábil con las manos, con mente emprendedora y ganadora. Tiene un negocio de venta de sandalias las cuales el mismo fabrica y vende tanto por pedido y sus propios diseños los vende directamente en su almacén, todas estas actividades la realiza solo o en ocasiones con ayuda de un familiar cuando el volumen de trabajo es muy grande.
Su negocio lo inicio como necesidad económica apuntando a un objetivo el cual es comprar casa, por eso quiere mejorar, tiene ideas, quiere sacar sandalias nuevas, nuevos estilos, mostrar, tratar de exportar es un hombre inquieto que vive por alcanzar sus metas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de materiales de sandalias, cuero, suelas, tiras, pretinas, agujas, hilos entre otros insumos y comprarlos en cantidades. 

Con este negocio no solo quiere alcanzar sus sueños, busca brindarle estudio y sostenimiento a sus dos hijos de 14 y 15 años de eda.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 45 year old man who is very good with his hands and has an entrepreneurial, winning mind. He has a business where he makes and sells sandals. He sells by order and he sells his own designs directly from his shop. He generally works alone, but sometimes has a family member to help him when he has a lot of work.

He started his business due to economic necessity and his goal is to purchase a home. This is why he would like to improve. He has ideas and would like to create new sandals, new products, show them, and attempt to export them. He is a restless individual to lives to achieve his goals.

He requests a loan to purchase materials like sandals, leather, soles, bands, leather bands, needles, thread, and other supplies that he will purchase in bulk. With his business, he hopes to not only achieve his goals, but also to provide an education and support to his two children, who are 14 and 15 years old.

loans.use: to purchase materials like sandals, leather, soles, bands, leather bands, needles, thread, and other supplies that he will purchase in bulk.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios femeninos. Ella necesita incrementar sus ventas,  abrir un local comercial, pues tiene un gran propósito más adelante, cuando su negocio crezca y es justamente el de adquirir su propia casa. Cuando en el año 2013 Milena estudiaba en la Universidad, sus compañeras  le sugirieron vender ropa y accesorios, ella acogió esa idea y hoy su deseo de crecimiento no cesa. Esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará blusas, faldas, vestidos, collares pulseras etc. Con esta inversión se propone incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. Milena vende a crédito y de contado y sus compras las realiza a distribuidores mayoristas de contado y su mercado lo conforman amistades y referidos por estos y su mayor desafío es lograr fidelizar su clientela y ahorrar.
texts.en: Milena, 29, is engaged in selling women’s clothing and accessories.  She needs to increase her sales, and open a shop as she has a great purpose for later on when her business grows, specifically, acquiring her own home.  In 2013, when Milena was studying at the university, her friends suggested selling clothing and accessories. She welcomed this idea, and today her desire for growth hasn’t ceased.  This is the reason she approached Kiva for a loan, her first with “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo”.  By means of this loan, she will purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, necklaces, bracelets, and other items.  With this investment, she proposes to increase her sales and profits, and make her Kiva loan a successful investment.  Milena conducts her sales in both credit and cash, and makes cash purchases from wholesale distributers.   In the market, she has formed friendships and obtained referrals through them.  Her greatest challenge is maintaining customer loyalty and saving money.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, necklaces, bracelets, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es:
Adalberto, de 71 años de edad, está casado y su esposa es profesora al igual que él, tiene 3 hijos, pero todos son mayores de edad y viven cada uno con su familia.
 
Adalberto, es profesor, toda su vida la ha dedicado a esta noble profesión, su esposa comparte esta misma profesión y juntos dan clases privadas a niños, en su casa de habitación, son pocos sus alumnos, ellos lo hacen así por su avanzada edad, pero a pesar de eso sienten el mismo deseo, por seguir enseñando y educando a los niños.

Adalberto, necesita el préstamo para reparar algunos muebles en su casa, pues ahí es en donde da las clases y quiere tenerlos en buenas condiciones para los niños.

Adalberto, desea continuar dando clases hasta que Dios se lo permita, ya que esa ha sido su satisfacción, dedicarse a enseñar y convertir niños y adolescentes en jóvenes provechosos y personas de éxito para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Adalberto, age 71, is married. His wife is a teacher, as is he.  He has three children, but they are all grown, and living with their families. 

Adalberto is a teacher; he has devoted his whole life to this noble profession.  His wife shares the same profession, and together, they give private classes to children in their home.  They have few students, they do it this way because of their advanced ages, but in spite of that, they feel the same desire to continue teaching and educating children.

Adalberto needs the loan to repair some tables in his home, as that is where he gives classes, and he wants to have them in good condition for the children.

Adalberto wants to continue giving classes for as long as God will allow, as it has been his delight to dedicate himself to teaching, and to turning children and adolescents into productive young people and successful persons for Society.

loans.use: to repair some tables in his home, as that is where he gives classes, and he wants to have them in good condition for the children.

loans.name: Sanginboy

texts.ru: Сангинбой мужчина, женат имеет 3-х детей. Отец и мать пенсионеры. Вот уже много лет он занимается скотоводством ему в этом помогает отец. У него крупно рогатые скоты. Жена Сангинбоя выходит на поле в качестве наемного работника и этим она помогает своей семье и мужу.  Сангинбой обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. У него сейчас временные трудности и он хочет на полученные деньги приобрести корм для своего скота. Он очень надеется что ему не откажут в этой просьбе. Сангинбой благодарит МДО Арванд за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Sanginboy is a married man with three children. His father and mother are retired. He has been involved in animal husbandry for many years, and his father has been helping him. Sanginboy has cattle. Sanginboy's wife goes to a field as a hired help in order to help her family and husband. Sanginboy requested financial support from MDO Arvand. He is currently experiencing temporary difficulties and wants to use this money to buy livestock feed. He really hopes that his request will not be refused. Sanginboy thanks MDO Arvand for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
After six weeks of rain, the mopane worms cling to mopane trees in rural Gwanda which is situated in Southern Zimbabwe. Sinikiwe normally sells beans and dried kapenta, but during the worm-harvesting season, she joins other women and men in collecting the worms by the bucket full, selling them to locals. Mopane worms are popular with the local residents. It is from this kind of business that Sinikiwe has managed to single-handedly grow her business and fend for her three daughters.

The dried mopane worm industry is a growing industry. Some worms are exported to South Africa and Botswana. Sinikiwe is one of the small-scale exporters to South Africa. Realising an opportunity to further expand her business, she is taking a group loan from Thrive Microfinance with her friends. She has been able to employ two more women to help her in catching, drying, grading, and flavouring the mopane worms. Sinikiwe and her group, God Bless, hope that a loan from Kiva will help her supply a couple of restaurants and someday finish building her house.

loans.use: To expend her mopane worm business.

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Walter de 30 años de edad es soltero. El Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “madres unidas”  la cual lo conforman 06 personas optimistas y solidarias. Walter se dedica al servicio de soldadura de metales. Gracias a su constante dedicación y servicio ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Su mayor deseo es  terminar sus estudios superiores. Solicitó el crédito para iniciar su propio negocio. El grupo “madres unidas” agradecen a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Walter es el primero del lado derecho, viste camisa color blanco y pantalón negro él se encuentra cargando en brazos a su pequeña sobrina.
texts.en:
Walter, who is 30 years old, is single. He belongs to the "Madres Unidas" communal bank, which is made up of 6 optimistic, supportive people. Walter makes a living by soldering metals. Thanks to his constant dedication and service, he has managed to improve his and his family's quality of life. 

His greatest dream is to finish his higher education. He requests this loan to start his own business.

The "Madres Unidas" group thanks Kiva lenders for their support. Walter is the first one on the left side in the photograph, dressed in a white shirt and black pants. He is holding his young niece.

loans.use: to start his own business.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат счастливая жена и мама двоих детей. Ей 33 года. Она вместе с семьей проживает в городке под названием Худжанд. Худжанд древний и красивый городок с высококультурным народом, который по сей день сохранил свою древнюю культуру, обычай и традиции. 
   Мухаббат работает в reception в одном из санаторий городка в течение года. Она любит свою работу. Мухаббат хочет построить карьеру и помочь мужу обеспечить детей. 
  Причина обращения Мухаббат за кредитом является приобретения холодильника. Так как зарплата мужа уходит на продукты питания и на обучения детей, а зарплата Мухаббат не большая, они не могут себе позволить приобрести холодильник и по этой причине Мухаббат обратилась за кредитом. Для нее сейчас холодильник является более чем необходимостью. Вы можете поддержать Мухаббат в этой ситуации.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a happy wife and mother of two children. She is 33 years old. She and her family live in a town called Khujand. Khujand is a historic and beautiful town with a highly cultured people, who have to this day retained their ancient culture, customs and traditions.

Muhabbat works in a reception area at one of the town's resorts. She loves her work. Muhabbat wants to build her career and help her husband to provide for the children. 

The reason for Muhabbat requested this loan is to purchase a refrigerator. Because her husband's salary is spent on food and children's education, and Muhabbat's salary is small, they cannot afford to purchase a refrigerator. This is why Muhabbat requested this loan. The refrigerator would be more than a necessity right now. You can support Muhabbat in this situation.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her family

loans.name: Salimata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 16 Juillet 2012 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son sixième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame salimata (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 40 ans, mariée et mère de 01 garçon. Elle est vendeuse de céréales locales : le mil, le mais et s’active dans la vente de bétails qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

 Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 10 sacs de céréales à 7000 f le sac et du bétail d’un montant de 30000 f  pour le revendre en  détails dans le marché local.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created and inaugurated on July 16, 2012. The group is entering its sixth loan cycle and consists of women who all live in the same area. They get along well and share a good team spirit. Their main business activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Salimata (standing at the far right and raising her hand) is the group’s featured borrower. She is a 40-year-old married mother of one boy. She sells local grains such as millet and maize, as well as livestock that she buys at the weekly markets.  

She will use this loan to buy 10 sacks of cereals at 7,000f each and 30,000f worth of livestock to retail at the local market.  

Her profits will allow her to help her husband with their household’s day-to-day expenses and to cover her child’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of cereals at 7,000f each and 30,000f worth of livestock to retail at the local market.

loans.name: Kancou's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 16 Juillet 2008 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kancou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 46 ans et mère de 11 enfants dont 03 garçons et 08 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de denrées de denrées alimentaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné à 17000 f ,  01 sac d’oignons à 10000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer activement à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on 16 July 2008 at the inauguration of the 'Banc Villageois'.  It is made up of women who have a lot of experience working with loan groups.  They are united around the principles of solidarity and mutual aid, and all work in small retailing.

Kancou (sitting on the far right with her hand raised in the photo) is the star borrower in this group.  She is 46 years old, married and mother to eleven children (three boys and eight girls).  She sells basic foodstuffs and plans to use her loan to buy 20 litres of refined oil for 17,000 francs CFA and a sack of onions for 10,000 francs CFA.  She will then retail them in her neighbourhood.

Kancou will use her profits to help pay for the day-to-day expenses of her household and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 20 litres of refined oil and 1 sack of onions for resale.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương operates a food stall selling fish. Hương is 28 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in the Hau Loc district, a  rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hương has been involved in the fish sales business for six years. 

The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to own a big cereals shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. Thanh is 22 years old, and she is married with one child. Thanh lives in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in her current business for three years.

The main hardship that Thanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widowed woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a rental houses business where she rents houses. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor conditions of the rental houses. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to renovate the rental houses. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: renovate the rental houses

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has a retail business selling metals. Nga is 43 years old, and she is married with two children. Nga lives in the Quang Xuong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nga has been involved in her current business for three years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Nga hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her fifith loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Euniah

texts.en:
Euniah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a widowed woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself as focused. 

Gerald operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture, and he has been involved in this business for 16 years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more timber for making furniture. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more timber for making furniture

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 18 years. 

He operates a retail business where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are individuals. He says that his biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bags. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bags

loans.name: Avelyn

texts.en:
Avelyn is 24 years old, is married, and has one kid. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Avelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Avelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Avelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Avelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Dilma

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer casada de 47 años de edad, ella es muy aplicada y trabajadora, vive con su esposo en un humilde hogar donde ambos se apoyan para el sostenimiento de este. 

Su vida laboral se centra en el comercio de ropa y bisutería, ofrece sus productos a familiares, amigos y cuando esto no le alcanza recurre a tocar puerta a puerta, en almacenes buscado una buena venta.


Su mayor sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia pero mientras tiene que fortalecer su negocio, necesita vender más y primero cubrir sus necesidades de alimento y pago de cuenta de servicios públicos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de los siguientes elementos:
•	Surtido de ropa(blue jeans, camisas, camisetas, blusas, conjuntos deportivos y faldas)
•	Surtido de bisutería (cadenas, collares, aretes, pulseras en acero)
texts.en:
Ruth is a married, 47-year-old woman. She is very dedicated and hardworking. She lives with her husband in their humble home where they both work in order to support their household. She has a business selling clothing and jewelry in the market. She sells her products to family and friends and, when she needs to sell more products, she sells door to door or in shops. 

Her greatest dream is to be able to purchase her own home, but first she needs to strengthen her business. She needs to sell more and cover basic necessities like food and public utilities. 

She requests a loan to purchase:
-Clothing (blue jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, athletic clothing, and skirts); and 
-Jewelry (chains, necklaces, earrings, and steel bracelets).

loans.use: to purchase clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to assist with her second harvest season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman and she owns a house that has no piped water but has electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Ruth has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Ditiro Group

texts.en:
When you meet Annamore, you get inspired by her sheer determination and willpower. This 35-year-old widowed mother of one school-going boy hasn’t let the hardships she has endured break her. She resides in the high density suburb of Glen Norah A, Harare. Her broiler chicken business is her source of livelihood. She started this business in 2012 after the death of her husband. With a small rental income from her tenants, she started her business. She started off with a batch of 50 chickens. She used to face challenges of delayed payment from her customers. This resulted in her not having chicken batches all the time, as she had to wait for her clients to pay her before she could purchase another batch.

The year 2013 was the turning point in her business. This is when two of her church mates and some friends approached her and told her about Thrive. They formed Ditiro group and joined Thrive Microfinance. Her 1st loan enabled her to increase her batch from 50 to 100 birds per batch. She was now able to keep chickens at various stages and not have to wait for her debtors to pay her. Her market has grown to include neighbours, church mates, and nursery schools. With her 2nd and 3rd loans, she continued to grow her business. She is now rearing batches of 200 at a time. With her current loan, Annamore is planning to extend her fowl run so as to further grow her business.

loans.use: to expand her fowl run.

loans.name: Bliss Group

texts.en:
Susan is a married mother of three children, one boy and two girls, who are all going to school. She started her business in 2013 supplying branded school bags to schools in Harare as per order.  She procures the bags from a local company and brands them as the schools need. She is planning to have her own factory to produce these school bags.

Currently she is targeting to supply 20 local schools by the end of 2015 and already has orders from five schools. Her products are competitive and able to attract customers due to the unique style they have. 

Susan is a member of Bliss group. They have just got their first loan from Thrive Microfinance. They have lived in the Lochinvar suburb of Harare for the past fifteen years and they know each other well. They are all focused ladies doing small businesses and these are their main sources of income.

As a group they have benefited from training and working as a group, running their small businesses and implementing a savings plan from Thrive Microfinance. A loan amounting to $500 will help Susan to improve her stock to supply school bags.

loans.use: to expand her business supplying school bags to local schools.

loans.name: El Shaddai Group

texts.en:
In the sprawling high density suburb of Budiriro 5, there is a busy shopping centre called Current shops. There is no service that you do not find at this bustling hub. There are grocery shops, pharmacies, saloons, tailors, mechanics, fruit and vegetable vendors, etc. It is here that you find Loice Chiwenga plying her trade. She sells maize at Current shops. Her business is situated next to a busy grinding mill, making her maize sell fast. She sells an average of 2 tonnes a month.

Loice is a member of El Shaddai group. She is 38, married, and a mother to school-going children. Loice and her group members joined Thrive in April 2013. Her group is in its 4th loan cycle with Thrive Microfinance. She started her business as a cross-border trader plying her trade in neighbouring South Africa and Zambia. Her business was failing as she often had too little capital to meet all her customers’ needs. Also crossing the border frequently was not easy for her as she had no one to leave her small children with. 

After receiving training from Thrive, she decided to venture into a business that did not cross borders and that was sustainable throughout the year. She started selling maize. Maize is the staple food in Zimbabwe and it is bought throughout the year. Loice hasn’t looked back; her business has grown and her quality of life has improved tremendously. She now sends her children to boarding school and has joined a housing co-operative where she is paying monthly contributions for her stand. Her future plans are to buy a 2 tonne truck that will help her in her maize business.

loans.use: To expand her maize wholesaling business.

loans.name: Lerato Group

texts.en:
As you get to Glenview furniture complex in Harare, you catch the sound of local highlife music, traffic sounds, and vendors calling out to attract their customers. Amongst the high-pitched voices is the voice of Monica.

Each morning Monica navigates through a series of maze-like rows of tables, chairs and beds to her furniture shop, which generally looks like all the other wooden structures at the complex. It is in this small corner of the world that Monica has managed to generate sufficient income for her family to buy just enough food for the day.

Monica is a married mother of four children. She is in the furniture business, producing kitchen chairs for resale. She started her business with help from her husband. This business has been a source of livelihood for her family.

In recent years, the global economic recession did not spare her business. Ever since then she has struggled to feed her family, let alone pay school fees for her children.

When Monica heard about Thrive Microfinance, she and a couple of friends formed a group called Lerato (meaning love in Sesotho, a South African dialect) and attended business management training. She hopes that a loan from Kiva will help the Lerato group expand their businesses and someday move away from the chaotic urban jungle of Glenview complex and open a shop in the central business district.

loans.use: To expand her business making and selling chairs.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru: Голибчону 44 года. Она счастливый отец двоих детей и муж. Детям 16 и 13 лет. Они ученики средней школы. Голибчон с детства занимался животноводством и с того времени набрался большого опыта в этой сфере деятельности, но несколько лет он не занимался животноводством как бизнесом. Голибчон работает преподавателем английского языка в средней школе, и получает не большую зарплату. Голибчон понимает, что необходимо начать свое дело, свой бизнес, чтобы увеличить доход семьи для будущего детей и накопить денег для их образования. По этой причине он решил начать животноводческий бизнес. Он будет выращивать скотин. Для этого бизнеса у него имеется коровник и большое количество корма для скота. Ему нужны заемные средства для приобретения мелко рогатых скотин, чтобы начать бизнес. Голибчон имеет большой опыт работы и считает, что его опыт несомненно поможет ему.
texts.en: Golibjon is 44 years old. He is a happy father of two children and husband. His children are 16 and 13 years old. They are students at a secondary school. Golibjon has been involved in animal husbandry since his childhood and has obtained extensive experience in this business since then, but he has not been involved in animal husbandry for several years now. Golibjon works as an English language teacher at a secondary school and earns a small salary. Golibjon understands that it is necessary to start his own business to increase the family's income for the children's future and to save money for their education. This is why he decided to start an animal husbandry business again. He will fatten up livestock. He has a cowshed and a lot of livestock feed for this business already. He needs a loan to buy small livestock in order to start the business. Golibjon has an extensive work experience and thinks that his experience will certainly help him.

loans.use: to buy small livestock in order to start his animal husbandry business

loans.name: Hugo Mauricio

texts.es: Hugo de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 28 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, inicio su actividad con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran ceca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la  fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 46 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and their four children. He grows corn and beans. Hugo has been farming for 28 years, having started with his own capital. He sells his products at different markets that are near his house. With the income he earns from his sales, Hugo is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and herbicides so that the can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, he can have more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and herbicides so that the can improve his land.

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 08 Janvier 2004, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Elles entretiennent de très bonnes relations et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marie (debout à l’extrême gauche) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 05enfants (01Garçon et04 filles) et s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide et d’huile de palme qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 10 sceaux de 20 kg à 8500 f le kg et paie 500 f par sceaux pour le transport et 08 bouteilles de  20 litres d’huile de palme à 160000 f.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’assister son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants (scolarités, habillements et soins sanitaires).
texts.en:
This group was created on 8 January 2004 and is made up of very active women.  They work very well together and get on well with one another.   The women all work in small retailing.

Marie (standing on the far left in the photo) is the star borrower in this group.  She is 51 years old, married and mother to five children (one boy and four girls).  She sells peanut paste and palm oil which she buys from the weekly market.  She then retails her products in her local area.  Marie plans to use her loan to buy 10 x 20 kilo buckets of paste for 8,500 francs CFA each, transport at 500 francs CFA a bucket and 8 x 20 litre bottles of palm oil for 160,000 francs CFA.  

Marie will use her profits to help her husband to pay for the day-to-day expenses of their household and children (schooling, clothing and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy 10 x 20 kilo buckets of peanut paste, pay for transport and buy 8 x 20 litres of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Munojot

texts.en:
Munojot is a very kind and honest woman. She is single and lives with her parents in the northern part of Tajikistan. She has an activity keeping, feeding and selling livestock. 

Munojot has a dream to be a sewer. She has experience and she is now planning to buy a new sewing machine. She wants to serve Tajik women as she likes to sew traditional women's dresses. 

Munojot is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy a new sewing machine to improve the quality of her dresses. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sountou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12 Novembre 2011, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Il existe une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Sountou  (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée est l’emprunteuse vedette) du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 Garçons et 05 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes, de patte d’arachide d’huiles de palme et d’autres condiments qu’elle écoule chez elle.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sceaux de 20 kg  de pattes d’arachide à 8500f le sceaux 02 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palmes à 100f le litre et d’autres condiments.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront à participer à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et à s’occuper de ses enfants (scolarisations, habillements, soins médicaux).
texts.en:
Created on November 12, 2011, this group is composed of very active women, who get along well within the group. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Sountou (sitting at the far right with her right hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is 45 years old and a married mother of three boys and five girls. She is active in selling vegetables, peanut butter, palm oil, and other condiments, which she offers at her home. 

With this new loan, she intends to purchase five 20-kg pails of peanut butter at 8,500 francs per pail; two 20-liter containers of palm oil at 100 francs per liter; and other condiments.  

Her profits will enable her to help with day-to-day family expenses and to take care of her children (schooling, clothing, and medical care).

loans.use: to purchase peanut butter, palm oil, and other condiments

loans.name: Yaya's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 16 Juillet 2008 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Yaya (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants : 03 garçons et une fille. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de la patte d’arachide elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 50 sceaux de 20 kg de à 8500f le sceau pour le revendre en détails dans les marchés locaux.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la  scolarisation des enfants et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on 16 July 2008 at the inauguration of the 'Banc Villageois'.  It is made up of women who have a lot of experience working with loan groups.  They are united around the principles of solidarity and mutual aid, and all work in small retailing.

Yaya (sitting on the far right with her hand raised in the photo) is the star borrower in this group.  She is 40 years old, married and mother to four children (three boys and a girl).  She buys and sells peanut paste at the weekly markets.  Yaya plans to use her loan to buy 50 x 20 kgs buckets of paste for 8,500 francs CFA a bucket.  She will then resell it at local markets.

Yaya will use her profits to help her husband to pay for the education of their children, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 50 x 20 kgs buckets of peanut paste for resale in local markets.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself as determined. 

Emily operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes, and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock of materials. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future she can improve her family's living standards.

This is Emily's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all types. 

James says his biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a quality life. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve standards for his family.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for business, and her primary customers are ladies. 

Beth says her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like bread, chips, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, and toiletries. 

She is 49-year-old married woman with two children who are 14 and 11 years old. Together with her family, she lives in Getafe, Bohol. Her husband earns a living by being a tricycle driver.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted items for the store. These will cause to improve the stock of her store and could attract more buyers to come. Her income will augment and start to balance her finances.  With these, she could now afford to buy nutritious food for the whole family. 

Gaudiosa hopes to expand her business to make it successful as well as to finance the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy assorted items for the store

loans.name: José Javier

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Las Decididas, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 25 años de edad, está casado y  de esta relación tienen una hija de 3 años de edad. Su esposa es asistente administrativa en una empresa de su familia.
Don José es un joven muy emprendedor que le gusta ganarse sus ingresos para él y su familia con su trabajo honrado y honesto, el tiene una empresa de limpieza que el brinda el servicio de limpieza y descontaminación de oficinas, hoteles y empresas públicas y privadas en la ciudad, el cuenta con dos personas quienes le colaboran con este trabajo y a quienes les paga por su servicios, además de limpiezas dan mantenimientos a aires acondicionado, computadoras entre otras, trabaja por contratos de forma particular, de esta forma el logra ganar su sustento y es fuente de ingresos para las familias de quienes laboran con él.
Este crédito es para comprar detergentes, desinfectantes y varios equipos de limpieza para brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad que brindan para obtener los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank named “Las Decididas” meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo. They engage in different business activities in order to improve their quality of life. They work in trade, food sales, and other business activities.

Sr. José lives in this place. He is 25 years old, married, and has a three-year-old daughter. His wife works as an administrative assistant at her family’s company.

Don José is an enterprising young man who enjoys earning an income for himself and his family by working honorably and honestly. He has a custodial services company in which he provides cleaning and decontamination services for offices, hotels, as well as public and private businesses in the city. José has two people who help him with the work and pays them for their services. In addition to cleaning services, he performs maintenance work on air conditioners, computers, and other appliances. He works through private contracts. By working in this manner, he is able to support himself and provide a source an income to the families of those who work for him.

This loan will be used to buy detergents, disinfectants, and various cleaning supplies so that he can provide better service. José has been with the Communal Bank for more than three years and enjoys the convenience of obtaining the loans. His dreams include continuing to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, disinfectants, and various cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to grow her fund used for her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenses.

She is positive that she could improve her business further if you will lend her an amount of 8,000 PHP. This new loan will go to more supplies of frozen foods, beverages and other merchandise that she sells so she can increase her profit from business. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Anita aims to grow her business for she desires to become rich someday. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for processed frozen foods, beverages, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 12 children. She describes herself as focused. 

Margaret operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delays from her supplier. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future she can improve the family's living standards and be successful. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has 4 children. 

He operates a motor vehicle repair business. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows maize. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. She says her biggest business challenge is weather changes. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable family. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with four children. For the past five years, she has been operating a restaurant and guest house. Dorothy’s business is located in a marketable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes herself to be kind and focused. Dorothy’s greatest business challenge is price fluctuations.

Dorothy is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This will be her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Dorothy’s business goal is to expand to a five star hotel within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business and generate wealth.

loans.use: buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Merza

texts.en:
Merza is a 37-year-old, married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merza has a pottery business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Merza would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a pottery business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Wonderful Group

texts.en:
Patience is a member of Wonderful group and she lives in Crowbrough Phase 3, Harare, with her husband and their 3 children.

Patience is a hard working woman who is helping her husband to pay school fees for their children and to meet other household consumption needs. She is into the business of selling kitchenware which she buys from South Africa and sells to other women in the nearby communities.

Patience and her other group members joined Thrive in August 2014 and they got their first loan, which was $1250 for the whole group, and she said she used her portion of the loan amount to increase her quantity of stock.

Patience and her group members have applied for a second loan amounting to $2,300 for the whole group. From the writer’s personal discussion with Patience, she said they are very appreciative of the business advice and first loan they received from Thrive and they want to continue benefiting from this program. She also said that she has a long term plan of opening a shop selling kitchenware in the Harare CBD and she said she will achieve this by making savings in her savings account.

loans.use: to continue to expand her kitchenware business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 51 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are married and one is still living with her. Since 2009, Adelaida has owned a sari-sari (variety) store. Her store is a growing business and she is determined to be successful. 

Adelaida is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy materials to repair the building where her store is. In the future, she plans to expand her business to earn more income and sustain her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her store

loans.name: Shahlojon

texts.ru: Шахлочону 39 лет. Она замужем и вместе с мужем растет двоих малолетних детей. Шахлочон по природе очень вежливый, нежный и добродушный человек. Она любит свою работу, потому что работает вместе с детьми. Шахлочон преподаватель родного языка в средней школе. В свободное от работы время Шахлочон занимается шитьем европейской и школьной одежды. Она с детства любила шить и возиться со швейной машинкой. Уже 9 лет, как Шахлочон увлечена всерьез шитьем. За столь долгий период она шила одежду на старой ручной швейной машинке. Ей давно хотелось иметь электрическую модернизированную швейную машинку, на которой бы было ей удобно шить. Она собрала сбережения, но тех сбережений не хватает для купли машинки. Шахлочон решила не откладывать покупку и обратилась за кредитом для реализации покупки. Она уверена, что она сейчас может купить швейную машинку и ее поддержат.
texts.en: Shahlojon is 39 years old. She is married and, together with her husband, raising two young children. Shahlojon is very polite, gentle and kind person by nature. She loves her work because she works with children. Shahlojon is a teacher of her native language at a secondary school. In her free time, Shahlojon is involved in sewing European and school clothing. She has loved to sew and work with a sewing machine since her childhood. Shahlojon has been seriously involved in sewing for 9 years now. All this time, she has been sewing clothing on an old, manual sewing machine and has been wanting to have a new electric sewing machine, which will be more convenient to use. She saved money, but it is not enough to buy the sewing machine. Shahlojon decided not to put off the purchase and requested a loan to make this purchase. She is convinced that she can now purchase the sewing machine and will be supported.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as hardworking. She operates a retail business where she offers printing and typesetting services and also runs an M-Pesa business. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are regular. 

Margaret says her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy printing materials to enable her open another business outlet. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy printing materials to enable her open another business outlet

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 12 years to 30 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells maize and sorghum. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is transportation. 

Florence will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of maize and sorghum. Her business goal is to expand business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 12 years to 26 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to have a successful business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is a married man with two children. For the past three years, he has operated a business selling fuel. Mark’s business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are all kinds of people. He describes himself as honest. Mark’s greatest business challenge is insufficient working capital.

Mark is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fuel. This will be his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Mark successfully repaid his previous loans. His business goal is to own a big fuel station within five years.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children. For the past six years, she has operated a business where she sells rice, sugar, flour, milk, and other items. Mary’s business is located in a good area and her primary customers are all kinds of people. Her greatest business challenge is insufficient working capital.

Mary is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, and other items. This will be her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans. Mary’s business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, flour, and other items

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are of all kinds. 

Stephen describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to increase his stock of meat

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailor shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all kinds. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of materials for making clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials for making clothes

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with seven children ranging in age from two to five. For the past 10 years, he has been a farmer who keeps cows and also grows maize. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are individuals. Francis describes himself as honest. He describes his biggest business challenge is weather changes. 

Francis is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs. This will be his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Francis will use the anticipated profits from his loan to farm more acres.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and farm inputs

loans.name: Aska

texts.en:
Aska is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself as determined and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells basins and mattresses. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of basins and mattresses. Her business goal is to have a successful business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins and mattresses

loans.name: Huldah

texts.en:
Huldah is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as ambitious and committed. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Huldah will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy another cow. Her business goal is to have a successful business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big dairy farm. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man with three children. For the past four years, he has operated a business where he sells cups, chairs, plates, flasks, and other items. Dominic’s business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes himself as determined. Dominic’s greatest business challenge is insufficient working capital. 

Dominic is requesting a 95,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cups, plates, and other items. This will be his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. Dominic’s business goal is to expand within five years and he hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: buy cups, plates, and other items

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailor shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all kinds. 

Millicent describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of materials for making clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of materials for making clothes

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is a  Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a retail business where she sells juices and fruit. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are of all kinds. 

Janeffer describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of juices and fruit. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of juices and fruits

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 35, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Paterno, a driver, and has two children who are still elementary students. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment the family's income to meet their daily personal expenses, support household needs and be able to send her children to school. 

Marites operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operation of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, beverages and toiletries to sell at her small store. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education.

Marites hopes to maintain and grow her business so the family can lead a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married mother of three children. She operates a posho mill where she grinds maize to produce maize flour. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy maize for milling. Her business goal is to be the best miller within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy maize for milling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of peas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen de 34 años de edad, es la propietaria de un taller de confecciones desde el mes del Mayo del año 2007, cuando realizó un curso de modistería en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje- SENA,  y al finalizarlo con nuevos conocimientos, habilidades y destrezas en el oficio de a confeccionar ropa, decidió emprender su propio negocio.  Hoy Karen tiene un taller en el que vende directamente a su clientela  de contado y a crédito, todos los días, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y comprando en almacenes especializados de insumos de confección, que  le ofrecen las mejores opciones de  precio y calidad. Su meta más adelante es comprar una máquina y terminar de construir su vivienda, aunque su mayor desafío es aumentar su producción y ahorrar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos, y accesorios , con el fin de incrementar sus producción, vender más  aumentando sus utilidades, para finalmente lograr el cumplimiento de sus sueños de prosperidad paso a paso.
texts.en: Karen, 34, has owned a sewing shop since May of 2007 when she took a dressmaking course at the “Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje: SENA” [NAS: National Apprenticeship Service]. After she completed her training, equipped with new knowledge, skills, and dexterity in making clothing, she decided to establish her own business.  Today, Karen has a shop where she sells directly to her customers in cash and on credit.  Every day, she works from seven in the morning until seven at night, and makes purchases from shops that specialize in sewing supplies, which offer the best price and quality options.  Her future goal is to purchase a sewing machine and complete construction of her home, although her greatest challenge is increasing production and saving money.  Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo”.  By means of this loan, she will purchase fabric, thread, and accessories for the purpose of increasing production, selling more clothing, and growing profits, and finally fulfilling her dreams of prosperity, step by step.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, esta soltera vive con su madre y sus hijos, tiene  como negocio la venta de productos de revista y mariscos, aprendió a trabajar como ayudante, fue adquiriendo experiencia y reunió capital para establecer su propio negocio, tiene  12 años de poseerlo,.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para invertir en lociones, cosméticos, cremas corporales y mariscos frescos, fortalecerá su negocio para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, espera seguir trabajando para ampliar su mercado y lograr tener una mejor situación económica.
Juana aspira tener su casa propia, tener un negocio fijo y dar a su familia una vida digna.
texts.en:
Juana is single and lives with her mother and her children. She has a business of selling catalog products and seafood. Juana learned how to work by starting out as an assistant. Once she acquired experience and gathered her own capital, she established her own business. She has been in business for 12 years.

Juana is requesting a loan so that she can invest in lotions, cosmetics, body crèmes, and fresh seafood. This will strengthen her business so that she can meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to keep working so that she can expand her market and have a better financial situation.

Juana aspires to have a house of her own, an established business, and a decent life with her family.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, cosmetics, body crèmes, and fresh seafood.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 32 years old and married with two children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cecelia has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, pants, other ready-to-wear clothing and bags.

Cecelia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, other ready-to-wear clothing and bags.

loans.name: Monica Patricia

texts.es: A sus 23 años de edad Patricia es madre soltera, sus 2 hijas tiene 4 y 7 años y  ya asisten a la escuela, Patricia se dedica a trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de ganado, Patricia comenta que es muy duro sacar adelante a sus hijas en la alimentación educación y demás necesidades diarias, Patricia necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de terneros que comenta que paga por hierba para alimentar a sus animales, Patricia tiene  la aspiración de comprar terneros, tener ganancias y seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 23, is a single mother.  Her two daughters are four and seven, and already attend school. 

Patricia works as a day laborer and raises cattle, and she says that it is very hard to provide her daughters with food, an education, and other daily necessities. Patricia needs the loan for the purchase of calves, and she says that she also pays for grass in order to feed her animals. 

Patricia aspires to purchase calves, have earnings, and keep working to improve her daughters’ quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Rose, who is 43 years old, married and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.
She has gained skills on enterprise start up, business record keeping and financial management offered by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her potatoes, maize and beans farming by buying quality seeds. This will enable her to increase her income to support basic family needs and education for her children.
Rose is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds that will help expand farming and increase family income

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Thach, 54, lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has eight children; three are married and living independently, while the other five are single and live under her support. To make a living, Thach is a rice farmer with a small rice farmland in her community. She has operated her business for 15 years and, on average, earns 3 USD each day.

Thach is requesting a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. Her loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle to travel conveniently. Thach would like to thank all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Wycliff

texts.en:
Wycliff is a married man with one child. For the past two years, he has sold polythene bags. Wycliff’s business is located in a good area and his primary customers are all types of people. Wycliff describes himself as determined. His biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. 

Wycliff is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of polythene bags. This will be his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Wycliff hopes that, in the future, he will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, cooking fat, sugar, sweets, and other items

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a married woman with four children. For the past six years, she has been a banana farmer. Roda’s business is located in a busy area. She describes herself as honest. Roda’s greatest business challenge is insufficient working capital. 

Roda is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy a cow. This will be her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans. Roda hopes that, in the future, she will have a large-scale farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 57 years old and is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Judith has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like noodles, sugar, eggs and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like noodles, sugar, eggs and other groceries.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, soap, snack foods and other groceries.

In the future Josephine would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jorelyn

texts.en:
Jorelyn is 45 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school. For the past five years, Jorelyn has operated a general store in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jorelyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida invirtió su anterior credikiva en una máquina de coser industrial, con la que se encuentra muy contenta porque los ingresos de su negocio y los ingresos familiares se incrementaron, porque logró aumentar su producción.
