Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, para comprar una fileteadora, maquina muy importante  con la cual mejorará la calidad en el acabado de sus prendas, pues cuenta con una maquina familiar que no realiza efectivamente el fileteado y  actualmente no es suficiente para satisfacer las exigencia de sus clientes.  Ella quiso enviar el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores en Kiva. “Muchas Gracias, por el apoyo recibido, he progresado mucho más y mi nivel de vida ha aumentado”.
texts.en: Zoraida invested her previous loan in an industrial sewing machine, and she is very happy with it. Both her business and family income have increased because she has managed to increase production. Today, she is applying for a new Kiva loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine, a very important machine which she will use to improve the quality of the finishes on her clothing.  Currently, she has a family machine that doesn’t thread efficiently, and it’s not sufficient to satisfy her customers’ demands.  She wishes to send the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Thank you very much for the support you have given. I have made a lot more progress, and my standard of living has increased”.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad se dedica al comercio de cremas cosméticos y productos capilares.  Hace dos años en el mes de Abril del año 2013, una amiga comerciante de productos mediante catálogos, le aconsejó que hiciera lo mismo que ella; como su amiga había tenido éxito en su negocio,  María decidió seguir los pasos de ella y hoy no para de conseguir nuevos clientes, para incrementar sus utilidades, lo cual se ha convertido en su mayor desafío. Maria vende directamente a sus clientes de contado y a crédito, trabajando todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su meta es ampliar su oferta y para ello requiere nuevos artículos que rotan muy rápidamente, como colonias cremas y en general productos capilares, esta es la razón por la cual ha acudido a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará estos artículos y con ello alcanzará su gran propósito de incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old. She works in the cosmetic creams and hair products business. Two years ago in the month of April 2013, a friend who sells products through catalogs advised her to do the same. Since her friend had been successful in her business, Maria decided to follow in her footsteps and today her biggest challenge is to get new customers in order to increase her profits.

Maria sells directly to her customers by cash and credit, working every day from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening. Her goal is to expand her supply and for this she needs new items to turn over very rapidly, such as scented creams and general hair products. This is the reason she came for a Kiva loan through which she will buy these items and so she will reach her big purpose of increasing her earnings. This is the first financing she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo

loans.use: to buy scented creams and general hair products

loans.name: Philisia

texts.en:
Philisia is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Philisia operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en: Non, a 32-year-old woman without children, lives in Kampong Cham province. She grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. For Non, this is her first cycle with Vision Fund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. She is the group leader of a three-member group. She will spend her loan portion to purchase fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn and save more money in order to expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to support her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gitithia Center Small Traders Self Help Group

texts.en:
The man holding a passbook in the photo is Joseph. He is forty three years old, married and has seven children who attend school. He is a member of Gitithia Center Small Traders Self Help Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise and financial management. 

Joseph is a carpenter. He is borrowing 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to boost his carpentry business. He wants to improve on his life and be able to provide a better future for his family. He is happy and thanks Kiva for the good work it is doing.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of timber to increase sales and thus profits

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Agnes from Nakuru. She is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in August 2012.

Agnes earns a living by running a kiosk. She has also been farming maize and beans as a business for the last two years. She is grateful for HiH EA training in enterprise and saving that has enabled her gain skills to run her enterprise well. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock to the kiosk and to purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides for maximum benefits. This will earn her more income and enable her to educate her children and provide for other basic needs for her young family.

Agnes is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to help boost farming.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso earns a living by engaging in carpentry work. He is a carpenter. In addition to that, he engages in farming and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She grows and sells rice. He is 42 year old married man with four children from Talibon, Bohol. His oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 10.

He has requested for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings and to purchase stock for the store. These materials will be very helpful in improving his farm and increasing the supply of his store. The farming inputs will create higher yield and enable him to sell more rice. He will be able to continue send his children to school for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings and to purchase stock for his store

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod is a hardworking man. He was born in 1978. He is from the southern part of Tajikistan and lives in a rural area. In his area no women work or do a business. Only the man keeps the family and does a business. 

Farhod is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. For almost two and a half years, he has been trading in construction materials.  He has a place of trading in a domestic market. He politely serves each client and attracts more customers around. 

Farhod requested financial support from KIVA lenders to buy goods like metal framework, wires and so on. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for resale

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 56 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmencita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmencita requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Carmencita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Carmencita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 39 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. For the past ten years, Jessica has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Jessica is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 64 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like fish, flour, sugar, oil, eggs and other foods for her food business.

Lilia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, flour, sugar, oil, eggs and spices for her food business.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Sopheak is 38 years old and the mother of four children. To support her family’s conditions, she grows rice and sells pork meat for additional income. This is her third cycle with Vision Fund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. She has fully paid back her past loan. In this group of three members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to purchase pork meat to sell. She hopes that she can support her children to obtain bachelor degrees and get high salary jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar home solution kit for her business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Paulina. She is 49 years old, married, and living with her husband and children. She sells second-hand clothes (Mitumba) in a small market in Limuru, Kenya and also farms spinach, kale and potatoes. 

She is borrowing 25,000 KES to add stock to her mitumba business so that she can sell more and meet her customers' demand. She says that this loan will help her improve living standards and provide better medical care and quality education for her children.

Paulina is happy and grateful to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes that will improve her income thus provide better medical care and quality education for her children.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The person in this photo is Joseph. He is sixty five years old, married, and a father of seven. Joseph is a vegetable farmer who operates a greenhouse as his main business. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014. Joseph has benefited a great deal from HiH EA training on enterprise and financial management. His training has enabled him to manage his business well. 

Joseph is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more quality inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to increase his income. His loan will assist him to provide for his family’s needs such as food, medicine, and paying school fees for his children. Joseph is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to improve his farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is thankful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for frozen and processed food products to sell. In addition to selling processed foods she also has a small general store. Her earnings help send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items like rice, canned goods, instant noodles, coffee, soda, frozen foods and processed foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return on her business for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and her children's education.

Corazon dreams of having a bigger General Store. She aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. She prays for a godly and victorious family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and beverages for her small general store and steamed buns, ham and stuffed meat that she sells.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
This is Melchora. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to buy more ready-to-wear supplies needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 51,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of clothing items she needs to improve her business. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Melchora wants for her business to thrive more so she can continue to provide for their everyday needs and expenses. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of men's, women's and kids' clothing.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 38 years old. She is married with two children, who are two and four years old and do not yet go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 20 years, while her husband is a businessman.

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for growing rice that she can sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees and to improve her family's welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing rice that she can sell.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 69 year old, married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Amparo has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Amparo requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Amparo would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Dancile

texts.en:
Dancile is 37 years old. She is married with three children, who are between one and six years old, one of whom goes to school. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 10 years. Her husband is also a farmer.

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for growing rice that she can sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees and to improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing rice that she can sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 70 years old and a widowed mother of seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mercedita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Mercedita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is aged 40 years old. She is married with six children, aged between 4 and 18 years. Four of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 21 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
A mother of six dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Sreymao is 43 years old. Nowadays, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 41,700 KHR per day. 

For Sreymao, this is the third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes that she can earn more income to buy a decent motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Орифчону 59 года. Он верный муж и отец. Орифчон с женой проживает в северном городке Конибодом. Его сын с невесткой живут в Российской Федерации. Они уехали на заработки и остались там. Орифчон работает водителем маршрутки "Газель" У него 40 летний стаж работы. К обращению за кредитом Орифчона подтолкнула обоснования нового бизнеса. Он с женой хочет открыть продуктовый магазин у себя дома, а продукты приобретет за счет кредита. Орифчон будет привозить продукты, а его жена займется продажей и контролем над бизнесом. Орифчон надеется, что они смогут начать бизнес, ведь роднее и ближе его жены никого нет. Они в жизни преодолели много бед и невзгод, и они уверены, что их совместный бизнес будет процветать.
texts.en: Orifjon is 59. He is a faithful husband and father. Orifjon and his wife live in the northern city of Konibodom. His son and daughter-in-law live in Russia. They traveled for work and stayed there. Orifjon is a bus driver on the "Gazel" line. He has 40 years of experience. Orifjon is applying for a loan to start a new business. He and his wife would like to open a grocery store at home and buy products with the loan. Orifjon will bring home the grocery products and his wife will sell them and run the business. Orifjon hopes that they will be able to start the business because there is no one closer or dearer to him than his wife. They overcame a lot of misery and hardship and are confident that their business together will flourish.

loans.use: to buy food products and open a grocery store

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon is a 62-year-old widowed mother with three children who lives in a community in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Two of the children are working in a factory, earning around $12 per day. Thon is requesting a loan because she needs finances to buy construction materials to renovate her house. This loan will help her and her family have a proper house and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), posee más de 5 años de experiencia en el cultivo, el producto lo vende en los diferentes mercados que se encuentra cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbecidas, etc. y el pago de alquiler de la parcela ya que no tiene terreno propio donde cultivar y así poder tener mejores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 36 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and their two children. She cultivates basic staple crops (corn and beans). Sandra has more than five years of farming experience. Her products are sold at different markets that are located near her home. With the income she generates from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Sandra is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, and other supplies. In addition, she will pay the rent on a parcel of land since she does not have land of her own for cultivation. This will help earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, other supplies, and the rent on a parcel of land.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive harvest on her farm. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Zenaida dreams for her farm to grow and flourish and to have a happy and prosperous life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  fertilizer and other farm supplies needed in growing pineapples and bananas.

loans.name: Yadira Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Las Decididas, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Yadira, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. El marido es maestro en construcción.
Doña Yadira es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que el gana se decidió a emprender un negocio, ella  vende productos de Yanbal, Avon, Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo,  ella sale a recorrer en las mañanas mientras sus hijos estudian, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante en ocasiones que su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 4 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank named “Las Decididas” meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo. They engage in different business activities in order to improve their quality of life. They work in trade, food sales, and other business activities.

Sra. Yadira lives in this place. She is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 12 and 11). Both of them are in school. Her husband is an expert in construction.

Doña Yadira is a woman who enjoys earning her own income so that she can contribute toward the household expenses and her children’s education. Seeing that her husband was not earning enough, she decided to start a business. Yadira sells Yanbal, Avon, and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She conducts her sales by going door-to-door, but she also sells from her home whenever her customers need something. Yadira makes her rounds in the morning while her children are in school. She extends credit for her products and collects payment every 8 or 15 days. Yadira has been in this business for more than two years. It has helped her family on those occasions when her husband has no work.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. Yadira has been with her Communal Bank for more than four years and enjoys being a member because the loans were used to start her business. Her dreams include providing the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and she works hard to support her family.

Maricel has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with two children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy thread to knit sweaters. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his four children and his desire is to educate them up to university.

Edson has been running a retail shop for seven years despite hardships of limited capital and debtors. He has a vision of becoming a wholesale trader. He gets additional income from a monthly salary and a motorcycle transport business.

Edson needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still young for school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a beauty salon shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a dryer, weaves, braids and hair chemicals to use in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer, weaves, braids and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Rafiki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Everline, a member of Rafiki Self Help group. She is twenty six years old, married and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in
the year 2014.

She runs a shoe selling business as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management and this has enabled her to manage her business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock so that she can increase her income. This will assist her in catering for the family needs and in paying school fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes to help expand their business thus earning more income to provide for their family's needs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nancy has operated a tailoring business for the past 5 years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are both ladies and gents.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth runs a small mixed-farm based in Kaspui village in the Nyamira region of Kenya. She is married and has 6 children, the youngest is 7 years old.
Elizabeth started farming 8 years ago, which is only 2 years after she got married. Today, she owns a 1.5 acre piece of land that she uses to keep 3 dairy cows, 30 heads of poultry, and grow tea and vegetables. Besides farming, Elizabeth also holds a salary-paying job and runs a small retail shop too. By now, you can tell that she is not your everyday farmer. She is a fierce entrepreneur with eyes for gaps in the market and grasps opportunities.
Elizabeth is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to open a grain milling shop. She is going to use the money to partially finance the purchase of machinery and equipment. She came up with the idea after realizing that farmers cover long distances to process their grains into flour for food. The milling traders charged predatory fees and their services were slow, leading to long queues and clients returning home late at night.
Your loan towards this borrower will not only have a huge impact on the borrower's family but also her surrounding community.

loans.use: to buy a grain mill

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, de 32 años de edad, está acompañada desde hace 18 años, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales, dos asisten a la escuela y uno estudia bachillerato.

Reina, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, decidió colocar este pequeño negocio, porque considero que era una manera de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, entre otros productos para la tienda, ya que necesita ofrecer más productos a sus clientes.

Ella desea seguir trabajando junto a su pareja, para darle una buena educación a sus hijos y que se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Reina is 32 years old and has been in a relationship since the age of 18. Her partner works in agriculture. They have three children, two of whom are in elementary school while the other one is in high school.

Reina takes care of the household duties, but she also has a store where she sells basic necessities. She decided to start this small business because it would be a way for her to help her partner with the household expenses.

The loan will be used to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, and other products for her store. She needs to offer more products to her customers. Reina wants to keep working with her partner so that they can provide a good education for their children. This will help them to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
Karla, de 31 años de edad y es madre soltera de una niña de 3 años de edad.

Karla, actualmente es empleada en una alcaldía, tiene varios años de laborar en esa institución, también se dedica a vender platillos típicos los fines de semana cerca de su casa, para obtener un poco más de ingresos.

Karla, necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos que necesita para continuar con su negocio e incorporar nuevos platillos típicos.

Karla, desea que su negocio sea rentable y sostenible, porque pronto se casará y va a necesitar dinero para organizar todo.
texts.en:
Karla, age 31, is the single mother of a three year old girl.  Karla is currently an employee of the city government.  She has worked for this institution for several years.  She also sells typical dishes close to her house on the week-ends.  She does this to get a little more income.

Karla needs the loan to buy the supplies that she needs to continue with her business and to incorporate new typical dishes.

Karla wishes for her business to be profitable and sustainable because she will soon be getting married.  She will need the money to organize everything.

loans.use: to buy the supplies that she needs to continue with her business and to incorporate new typical dishes.

loans.name: Dilma Yaneth

texts.es: Dilma es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo de 3 años y una bebe de 5 meses, Dilma se dedica a la venta de ropa y a veces también se va a trabajar en  al jornal de trabajos del campo, Dilma comenta va a invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería en ropa para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ventas, Dilma aspira mejorar sus ingresos y de este modo poder darles a su hija e hijo lo que necesiten y mejorarles la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dilma is a single mother, with a three-year-old son and a five-month-old baby girl. Dilma sells clothing and sometimes works in the fields for daily wages. 

Dilma says that she is going to invest the loan in purchasing merchandise in the form of clothing in order to improve her business, and thus, her sales. 

Dilma aspires to improve her income, and in this way, be able to give her daughter and son what they need, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Chepkiripseet Kotes Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Isabella, a member of Chepkiripseet Kotes Group in Nakuru. She is 26 years old, married, and a mother of two. 

She does maize, beans, and dairy farming. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits from her business. 

Isabella is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will greatly boost her business, hence, increasing her income, which will enable her to cater to her children's clothing, food, and other needs of the family. 

Isabella is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and pesticides to boost farming.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is single and has three children, two of whom go to school. She has additional family members.

She sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail and wholesale basis.

Her major business challenges include transportation. She is aspiring to build her own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 41 years old and a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities including biscuits, chips, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, soap and other goods. She is a married woman with a 13-year-old child. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years already.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, shampoo and soap. This stock will attract more buyers to shop and purchase at her store. In this way, her earnings will improve and enable her to set aside some savings. She could now cater to the needs of her growing child including sending her to school.

She hopes that her current livelihood will expand and become more sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Susannie

texts.en:
Susannie is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Susannie works very hard to provide for them.

Susannie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susannie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Susannie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of clothes to resell.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 52 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena operates a candy making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Rowena requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mariam has operated a tailoring business for the past five years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags and disposable products like containers, cutlery, and plates, etc.
